description: We are forced to ask: Will the Weather Channel now start naming storms on other planets?

title: Taking a Deep Look at Tools for Scuba Divers
description: In the middle of winter there can be few more spine-chilling thoughts than the idea of slipping into the ocean for a dip. But at least one group of people are attracted to the idea of year-round: scuba divers.

title: Ministers Comments on Gay Rights Raise Questions on Role in Inauguration
description: 9:11 p.m. | Updated  A revised version of this post is available here.5:45 p.m. | Updated The minister President Obama picked to deliver the benediction at his inauguration this month delivered a sermon the 1990s in which he called on fellow Christians to fight the aggressive agenda of the gay rights movement, and advocated the healing power of Jesus as the only way out of a homosexual lifestyle.

title: The New Mantra: Replacing Om With Glam
description: ROLL over, $800 yoga mat.

title: Taking in Paris Any Day, Any Century
description: PARIS  In a 1789 painting of the Bastille, the French artist Hubert Robert portrayed that Paris fortress as a huge, seemingly impregnable structure and the Parisian revolutionaries who razed it as small, vulnerable human beings. More than two centuries later, thanks to 3-D modeling software, a different picture of the Bastille emerges. In its recreated setting it is the Bastille that seems small, even vulnerable.

title: FM Radio on Cellphones, Long Sought by Broadcasters, Comes to Sprint
description: For years, the radio industry has watched with worry as consumers snap up all kinds of electronic gadgets from cellphones to tablets to set-top TV boxes that deliver seemingly every kind of media but that old standby, terrestrial radio.

title: Mobile Chargers Ease That Feeling of Powerlessness
description: You undoubtedly know people so smitten with their smartphones and tablets that they experience separation anxiety when asked to put them away, even if its just long enough to get through dinner. But that is nothing compared with the angst they feel when their devices batteries are getting low. Think tremors and rending of garments.

title: A.I.G. Rejects Shareholder Suit
description: The American International Group has wisely chosen to avoid joining a shareholder lawsuit against government agencies that bailed it out with $182 billion in loans and capital. In an unequivocal statement released Wednesday afternoon, the company said its board would not join a case brought by Starr International, the investment vehicle controlled by A.I.G.s former top executive Maurice Hank Greenberg, in courts in New York and Washington.

title: Solis Stepping Down as Labor Secretary
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of Labor Hilda L. Solis announced on Wednesday that she was stepping down, becoming the latest woman to leave President Obamas cabinet at a time when his personnel choices are drawing scrutiny for their lack of female candidates.

title: A Late-Night Show Where Cage Holds Sway
description: For anyone confronted constantly with gloomy prognostications about the decline and demise of classical music, high art, Western culture or whatever, the sight of a capacity audience assembled at 10 p.m. on a Tuesday to hear a program of modern American string-quartet music is a powerful shot in the arm.

title: Edgar Kaplan Winter Regional in Manhattan
description: Peter Clark and Jess Jurkovic of New York City tied for the Greater New York Bridge Association Flight B Player of the Year award.

title: No Caution in the Eye of the Storm
description: Im in love again! To watch Linda Lavin, wearing a rapturous smile, toss back her head, throw out her arms and shiver with delight while delivering the title phrase from a sexy Cy Coleman-Peggy Lee ballad was to observe a singer deliriously consumed by the lyrics celebration of second and third romantic chances. Her performance on Tuesday evening at 54 Below made you ponder what the term in love means in the 21st century, when in the 20th it was assumed to be the divine state to which everybody aspired with an implied happy ending.

title: Dishs Potemkin Offer for Clearwire
description: Sprint and Softbank are being forced into tactical warfare. U.S. satellite-TV company Dish Network, run by the enigmatic Charlie Ergen, put forward a highly conditional offer for Clearwire, a spectrum owner integral to the ambitions of Sprint and its Japanese buyer. Though the bid is unlikely to go far, it could pressure Sprint to pay more  or strike a deal with Dish.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Steve Ballmers N.B.A. Plans and Why C.E.S. Matters
description: Here are some of the more interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: C.E.S. 2013: Driving Directions With a Human Touch
description: One of the problems facing GPS makers is how to make maps that drivers can use while paying attention to the road rather than the screen.

title: Behind the Bedroom Door
description: The no-longer secret life of teenagers.

title: Chronicles of a Bed Unmade
description: A GOOD way to find out if you should enter a teenagers bedroom is to ask yourself a single, unsparing question: Am I a teenager?

title: Where Cats Run Free
description: In Pittsboro, N.C., Siglinda Scarpa has turned her home into an animal sanctuary.

title: 300 Cats, Yes. Craziness, No.
description: PITTSBORO, N.C.

title: Oscar Memories of the Last, or First, Time
description: On Thursday morning the Oscar nominees will at last be revealed, giving shape to what has been an unusually multidimensional race. The stars and directors of contenders like Lincoln, Argo, Zero Dark Thirty, Silver Linings Playbook and Django Unchained have been making the rounds to drum up support. For some of them by Thursday afternoon it will be time to pack up the borrowed finery and the studio-approved talking points, and go home. For others it will be the next leg of the race: a six-week sprint to a finish line that involves potentially hefting a gold statuette on Feb. 24 and delivering an embarrassing (or sweet, or funny, or ideally, all three) acceptance speech. As a primer for those left standing  and entertainment for those following along  here are some memories of Oscar experiences from previous winners and nominees, excerpted from interviews at premieres and galas this season.

title: Flat Roofs, Mountain Views and Really Close Neighbors
description: A modern house in Boulder is unconventional in a number of ways.

title: Pictures of the Day: New York and Elsewhere
description: Photos from New York, Jordan, South Africa and Ivory Coast.

title: The Semi-Detached Solution
description: GOOD design is often defined as an elegant solution (or a series of elegant solutions) to a complex equation whose variables include space, money, time and human behavior. Also personal biography, history, taste and municipal law.

title: Where Pills and Crime Collide
description: LOS ANGELES  Important safety information: Adverse reactions associated with this product include dry mouth, nausea, headaches, anxiety, insomnia.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. The bedroom in my apartment has very small windows. Should I try to do something to make them look bigger?

title: Remembering Richard Ben Cramer
description: The first time I met Richard Ben Cramer, who died this week at 62, I was seeking his advice about a book I wanted to write, and so I called and invited myself down to Marylands Eastern Shore. Thats where Richard lived, about a two-hour drive from Washington, in a couple of weathered farmhouses  one for living with his companion at the time and later his wife, Joan, and one for writing. He said sure, come anytime and we would get lunch, he wasnt doing much of anything, which of course was never true.

title: What You Get for ... $1,395,000
description: BLUE HILL, ME.

title: Homes for $1,395,000
description: Properties in Los Angeles, Maine and Denver.

title: Creature Feature
description: A meeting of a Swiss Surrealist and a British rock band in the imagination of an Italian designer was the genesis for Pig on the Wings. The cloven-hoof stool by Michael Breschi, founder of the Milan-based (and soon to be Miami-based) studio Gentle Giants, pays homage to Meret Oppenheims 1939 Traccia table, whose legs terminate in a pair of bird feet. And the name is a slightly scrambled reference to Pigs on the Wing, a two-part love song on Pink Floyds 1977 Animals album. (Mr. Breschi listened to Animals a lot while designing the piece.)

title: Casting Off the Yolk
description: Quirky, the online developer of household products, has introduced a new way to separate raw eggs. Pluck (about $13) is a silicone bulb with a removable plastic nozzle. Crack an egg into a bowl, position the nozzle over the yolk and give a little squeeze. The yolk slithers up into the bulb, ready to be released with another squeeze.

title: A Deadpan Gaze at the Down and Out in China
description: I regret eating glass, San Bao, the depressed young hero of Zhang Yuans Beijing Flickers, says in a voice-over, the bottom half of his face covered in a white bandage. More things he regrets: checking into a hospital, where he cant pay the bill, and also checking out of the hospital. After all, life in the big city isnt going so well. His girlfriend has left him (for a richer man), hes lost his job, and his dog  Lucky, no less  has run away. He cant even kill himself properly  a suicide attempt on a train track turns into a Buster Keaton gag.

title: Less Is Not in Store
description: Can modernist design be dreamy? A show that runs Tuesday through April 21 at MAKK, the Museum of Applied Art in Cologne, Germany, makes a strong case for the affirmative. Isnt It Romantic: Contemporary Design Balancing Between Poetry and Provocation focuses on what its curator, Tulga Beyerle, considers the softer side of a rigorous aesthetic movement. Design is escaping from functionalism, Ms. Beyerle said. Young designers are critical of industrial production. Included are projects by newcomers like Julien Carretero from France (his ladder, above right, which is made from oak excavated from a medieval Dutch city wall, will appear in a section devoted to concepts), but also work by established designers who have turned away from modernist strictures. Among the veteran offerings are Maurizio Galantes Cactus sofa for Cerruti Baleri (above left) and Studio Makkink & Beys Birdwatch cabinet (above center). The catalog (about $32) is available at dermuseumsshop.de. Information: 011-49-221-2212-3860.

title: Drapery Through the Ages
description: If it had not been for the Parisian designer, we in the West would be hanging rags in our windows, said the design historian Gail Caskey Winkler, author of Capricious Fancy: Draping and Curtaining the Historic Interior, 1800-1930 (University of Pennsylvania Press, $85). French design ideas fired up the English and spread from there, leading to tented beds, swagged windows and portieres.

title: A Strong Thread in a Torn Union
description: When Elizabeth Keckley, a former slave turned professional dressmaker and confidante of Mary Todd Lincoln, published her memoir, Behind the Scenes, in 1868, the response was vitriolic. One Washington reviewer called Mrs. Keckley treacherous and asked: What family of eminence that employs a Negro is safe from such desecration? Where will it end?

title: Sales at Robert Martin Designs, John Robshaw and Others
description: Tomorrow through Sunday, Robert Martin Designs will discount all showroom samples up to 50 percent (a glass-and-cherry wood coffee table, regularly $5,000, is $3,600), Brooklyn Navy Yard Building 280, Suite 223, 63 Flushing Avenue (Navy and Sand Streets), Brooklyn, (917) 603-0644, robertmartindesigns.com.

title: House Hunting in ... France
description: 19th-CENTURY CASTLE IN NORMANDY

title: A 19th-Century Castle Outside Rouen
description: An elaborate brick and limestone structure on 92 acres, with its own chapel, is on the market for $2.7 million.

title: Four Tips for Better Sunrise Photos
description: While fireworks make for spectacular pictures, they show up only so many times a year, whereas natures fireworks  sunrises and sunsets  are available daily.

title: A Send-Off for a Harlem Funeral Director
description: As a funeral director in Harlem for more than six decades, George Bernard Benta delivered his personal brand of service for luminaries like Langston Hughes, James Baldwin, Paul Robeson, Etta Jones, Coleman Hawkins, Gil Noble and Alvin Ailey.

title: Israeli Election Ads Ruled Too Offensive for Broadcast Rack Up Views on YouTube
description: Efforts to introduce some drama, or comedy, into the somewhat lackluster Israeli election campaign, in the form of satirical television ads for two parties at opposite ends of the political spectrum, have been stifled by the countrys Central Election Committee, which deemed them too offensive to broadcast. Despite those rulings, however, both ads have attracted tens of thousands of views online this week.

title: Questions of Strategy as Griffin Has Surgery
description: Washington Redskins quarterback Robert Griffin III had two knee ligaments surgically repaired Wednesday  including a reconstruction of the anterior cruciate ligament and a repair of a tear in the lateral collateral ligament  the result of a knee injury he sustained during Sundays playoff loss to the Seattle Seahawks.

title: Gov. Cuomos Wish List
description: Gov. Andrew Cuomo vowed on Wednesday that New York would soon enact the toughest gun assault weapon ban in the nation. Period. New Yorkers should hold him to that promise. He made stronger gun laws an urgent priority in his annual State of the State address, but he will need to present the specifics quickly to a divided Legislature and push lawmakers to act. The supporting documents for his speech suggest that he plans to tighten the ban on large magazines and require all gun owners to reapply for a permit every few years, replacing the lifetime permits allowed in some counties. He also wants mental health professionals to be able to report if someone is dangerous, allowing law enforcement to confiscate the individuals firearms. And he would make the process of licensing guns more efficient while increasing penalties for use of guns illegally.

title: Restoring Irans Heritage of Magnificent Homes in an Age of High Rises
description: KASHAN, Iran  A petite woman in gray boots and a checkered scarf, Shanaz Nader had spent much of her adult life abroad, with long stretches in Tokyo, London and New York. But here she was braving a cold wind in this desert city three hours south of Tehran, making her way through a maze of high mud-brick walls.

title: The Scene of an Accident at Pier 11
description: A ferry bound from Atlantic Highlands, N.J., to Manhattan ran into a pier Wednesday, injuring scores of people.

title: The Debt Ceilings Escape Hatch
description: LOS ANGELES

title: A Frenchman Dreams of Russia
description: RETURNING home from a visit to Russia in 1774, the philosophe Denis Diderot wrote that in France, he could not help but think that Ive the soul of a slave in a country where menare called free, whereas in Russia he had the soul of a free man in a country where men are called slaves.

title: Borrowed Hearing Aid Opens New World to Teenager
description: He thought he was the only one.

title: Helping Hands in Haiti
description: To the Editor:

title: The Person Ill Be ...
description: To the Editor:

title: Do Guns Make Us More Safe, or Less?
description: To the Editor:

title: Out of Afghanistan
description: To the Editor:

title: Stopping the Squirming
description: To the Editor:

title: New Evidence Expected in WikiLeaks Case
description: FORT MEADE, Md.  Military prosecutors preparing to try Pfc. Bradley Manning said on Wednesday that they would introduce evidence that Osama bin Laden requested and received from a Qaeda member some of the State Department cables and military reports that Private Manning is accused of passing to WikiLeaks.

title: Abbas and Hamas Leader Meet at Egypts Invitation
description: JERUSALEM  President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority met on Wednesday in Cairo with Khaled Meshal, the political chief of Mr. Abbass rival, Hamas, but it was unclear if they were able to overcome any of the differences that have fueled a bitter five-year feud.

title: A Trillion-Dollar Coin Brings a Jackpot of Jests
description: WASHINGTON  A bizarre but seemingly legal idea to get around the countrys debt ceiling using a trillion-dollar coin is having its day in Washington.

title: Rodgerss Homecoming Calls Up a Slight
description: GREEN BAY, Wis.  By the time the Packers-49ers game kicks off Saturday night, it will have been 7 years, 8 months, 20 days and a little more than 3 hours.

title: When Burglary Is Not Burglary
description: Matthew Descamps was convicted in 2008 of being a felon in possession of a handgun and ammunition under federal law, which usually leads to a maximum sentence of 10 years in prison. But a federal trial judge in Washington State more than doubled that sentence to 21 years and 10 months under the Armed Career Criminal Act.

title: A Step Backward in Bank Regulations
description: A committee of central bankers and regulators from more than two dozen countries, including the United States, has disappointingly given in to lobbying by big banks and watered down important rules meant to strengthen the global financial system. The change will let banks include risky financial instruments like corporate bonds and mortgage-backed securities as part of their liquid asset reserves, which are meant to cover up to 30 days of cash outflows during crises. And the banks have until 2019, not 2015, to comply fully with the easier standards. Each nation will decide when and how to implement the rules.

title: Mexico: Killer Dog Case Widens
description: A pack of feral dogs may be responsible for the deaths of as many as five people in a Mexico City park, the authorities said Wednesday. Last week, the police said dogs had killed four people, including a woman and a baby boy, whose mutilated bodies were found in the park in December. Now, prosecutors are investigating if the wounds found on a fifth person, a 15-year-old girl who died in December, are consistent with dog bites. The authorities have captured several dogs, spurring an online campaign to save them, but it is not clear if any are the culprits.

title: S.E.C. Seeks to Penalize 2 Auditors in Bank Case
description: In its first case against auditors stemming from the financial crisis, the Securities and Exchange Commission on Wednesday took action against two KPMG employees who had given a clean audit opinion to a Nebraska-based bank holding company that later failed because of bad loans it had made to real estate developers in Nevada and Florida.

title: Brazil: Prosecutor to Analyze Testimony by Suspect About Former President
description: The prosecutor general, Roberto Gurgel, said Wednesday that he would analyze testimony in which a businessman convicted in an embezzlement and vote-buying scheme tied Brazils former president, Luiz Incio Lula da Silva, to the scandal. The businessman, Marcos Valrio de Souza, received a 40-year sentence in October after he was found to have operated much of the scheme, the mensalo, or big monthly allowance, named after payments received by legislators. The Supreme Courts trial of suspects in the scheme resulted in the conviction of senior figures, including Mr. da Silvas former chief of staff, who was sentenced to nearly 11 years in prison. In testimony, Mr. de Souza said he deposited funds in 2003 for Mr. da Silvas personal spending, in an account controlled by another aide to the former president. After Mr. de Souzas assertion, Mr. da Silva said he could not respond to a lie. Mr. Gurgel said no decision had been made on a formal investigation.

title: Democracy in the House
description: The only reason that income taxes on 99 percent of Americans did not go up this month was that Speaker John Boehner briefly broke with an iron rule of Republican control over the House. He allowed the fiscal-cliff deal to be put to a full vote of the House even though a strong majority of Republicans opposed it.

title: Probation for Ex-SAC Analyst Who Cooperated in Insider Trading Inquiries
description: A former analyst at SAC Capital Advisors who has become a crucial informant in the governments insider trading investigations avoided prison on Wednesday after a judge sentenced him to probation.

title: Lipton Goes Back to Basics With a Tea Bag
description: BACK in the Mad Men days, a trade organization known as the Tea Council of the U.S.A. celebrated the beverage its members sold with ads that carried the theme Take tea and see.

title: Despite No Direct Tie to Steroids, Piazza Falls Short
description: Voters roundly rejected some of the most accomplished baseball players in the history of the game Wednesday, denying them entry into the Hall of Fame because of their documented association with performance-enhancing drugs. Caught in the middle was Mike Piazza, who hit 396 home runs as a catcher, more than any other player at the position, but who was never directly linked to steroids or human growth hormone.

title: The Woes of Roe
description: Forty years ago this month, the Supreme Court handed down the great abortion rights decision Roe v. Wade. To be honest, youre not going to be seeing a whole lot of cake and Champagne. Time magazine recognized the occasion with a downbeat cover story. (Theyve Been Losing Ever Since.) Gallup polls suggest support for abortion rights is fading, particularly among young Americans, and that more people now regard themselves as pro-life than pro-choice.

title: The Obama Coalition vs. Corporate America
description: The slow implosion of the Republican Party  along with the growing strength of a Democratic coalition dominated by low-to-middle-income voters  threatens the power of the corporate establishment and will force big business to find new ways to reassert control of the policy-making process.

title: Big Teachers Fund to Sell Its Gun Shares
description: One of Americas largest pension funds began on Wednesday to divest itself of firearms holdings, a response to the schoolhouse shooting in Newtown, Conn., that other pension funds could follow.

title: Benefits of College Degree in Recession Are Outlined
description: Young adults have long faced a rough job market, but in the last recession and its aftermath, college graduates did not lose nearly as much ground as their less-educated peers, according to a new study.

title: Postgame Confrontation Will Cost Anthony a Game
description: Soon after the Knicks landed in Indianapolis on Wednesday, they learned the N.B.A. had suspended Carmelo Anthony for one game without pay for confronting Kevin Garnett on Monday night.

title: Deep Cuts Raise Questions About Morgan Stanley
description: When Morgan Stanleys top executives gathered in mid-September at the Gramercy Park Hotel in Manhattan to discuss strategy, some participants complained that the room was too small.

title: Robert Borks Tragedy
description: Even before Robert Bork died last month, he had achieved something close to martyrdom. In the quarter-century since the Senate rejected his Supreme Court nomination, successive generations of conservative lawyers and activists have carried the torch, depicting his defeat as an injustice of historic proportion. Following his death at the age of 85, liberals mostly maintained a respectful silence while conservatives dusted off old complaints about the conduct of the confirmation hearing and the unfairness, in their view, of the borking the nominee received. Clearly, the Bork Battle survives Bork.

title: Chvez, or at Least His Sash, Is Set for Venezuela Inauguration
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  President Hugo Chvezs supporters have not ruled out swearing him in from his hospital in Havana. His detractors are calling for government investigators to go check his pulse themselves. The justices whom Mr. Chvezs allies have named to the Supreme Court have decided that he can continue to govern in absentia.

title: Justices Look at Legality of Drunken-Driving Test
description: WASHINGTON  Prosecutors in Missouri, supported by the federal government, came to the Supreme Court on Wednesday with a big request: They wanted the justices to rule that the police do not need warrants to obtain blood samples in drunken-driving investigations.

title: Power for the Women of India
U.S. to Press Fight of Detainees Appeal
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration, after a high-level debate among its legal team, told a federal appeals court on Wednesday that the conviction of a Guantnamo Bay prisoner by a military commission in 2008 was valid even though the charges against him  including conspiracy and material support for terrorism  were not recognized as war crimes in international law.

title: Reframing the Gun Debate
description: This time things are different.

title: Pastor Chosen for Inaugural Was Criticized as Antigay
description: WASHINGTON  The pastor whom President Obama has chosen to deliver the benediction at his inauguration this month delivered a sermon in the 1990s in which he called on fellow Christians to fight the aggressive agenda of the gay rights movement and advocated the healing power of Jesus as the only way out of a homosexual lifestyle.

title: In Defense of Hagel for Defense
description: Critics are pounding President Obamas choice for defense secretary, Chuck Hagel, as soft on Iran, anti-military and even anti-Semitic. This is a grotesque caricature of a man who would make a terrific defense secretary.

title: State Department Official Urges Britain Not to Loosen Ties With European Union
description: LONDON  The United States entered Britains debate over its relationship with the European Union on Wednesday, when a senior diplomat implicitly warned the British government not to do anything that might endanger its membership in the 27-nation union.

title: Afghan Amnesty Program Falls Short, Leaving Ex-Insurgents Regretful and Angry
description: MEHTAR LAM, Afghanistan  Eidi Mohammed, a former Taliban commander who recently renounced violence and sought amnesty under the Afghan governments reconciliation program, has had another change of heart. Now he is thinking about rejoining his old comrades. Jobless and losing hope he will ever find work, Mr. Mohammed, 38, took his frustrations to provincial officials. They told him there was nothing they could do.

title: Flu Widespread, Leading a Range of Winters Ills
description: It is not your imagination  more people you know are sick this winter, even people who have had flu shots.

title: Shopping With Rita Ora
description: Bee-Shyuan Chang goes shopping with Rita Ora at Opening Ceremony, where the singer reveals her style evolution and inspirations.

title: The It Girl
description: At 22, Rita Ora, the prized protge of Jay-Z, has been rapidly winning over designers with her carefree style.

title: From England, Fashions Latest Darling
description: NEW year, new girl.

title: Things I Saw  No. 52
description: Suggestions for what youd like Jason to see and draw may be sent to thingsisaw@nytimes.com.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, Jan. 10, 2013
description: Anyone who has a sash, bring it along, because tomorrow the people will be invested as president of the republic, because the people are Chvez,

title: At Once Catholic and Secular, France Debates Gay Marriage
description: PARIS  Frigide Barjot has made a career of mocking the establishment of France, dressing in fluorescent pink sweaters, playing in a band called the Dead Pompidous and hosting a philosophy soire at which she handed out T-shirts with the logo, Kierkegaard is my homeboy.

title: Teenage Bedrooms: The Forbidden Frontier
description: Emily Cohn and Emma Orlow, seniors in high school, spent a year interviewing their fellow teens about everything from collages to carpets. The result: The Do Not Enter Diaries.

title: New York Is Moving Quickly to Enact Tough Curbs on Guns
description: New York State is nearing agreement on a proposal to put what would be some of the nations strictest gun-control laws into effect, including what Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo vowed on Wednesday would be an ironclad ban on assault weapons and large-capacity magazines, and new measures to keep guns out of the hands of criminals and mentally ill people.

title: Something to Fill In
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Theres a slight trick to getting the theme of todays puzzle by Kevan Choset, and its not that the theme material is a bit more scattered than usual.

title: Editors Note: January 10, 2013
description: A picture on Monday with an article about a new MagicBand technology that Walt Disney World plans to introduce in the coming months showed people wearing rubber bracelets that will be used with the technology. The people in the picture, which was provided by Disney, are actually models posing to demonstrate the new system, not Disney World customers. Such a posed picture should not have been used to illustrate the article.

title: Lawmaking Maverick Resumes Course in Nebraska
description: LINCOLN, Neb.  They came to him with hugs and elbow bumps (he rarely shakes hands), wide grins and hearty backslaps.

title: Hall Vote Puts a Damper on Cooperstowns Party
description: While many who live in and work in Cooperstown were braced for a blow to the towns annual Hall of Fame weekend, it took Wednesdays depressing election announcement to land the actual punch. The traditional induction party will go on as it always does in late July, but because it wont involve a single living honoree, its unclear just who exactly will be inclined to show up.

title: Trial Begins in Death of 2-Month-Old Girl
description: For almost five years, Li Hangbin, 28, has been jailed on Rikers Island, awaiting trial in the 2007 death of his 2-month-old daughter, Annie.

title: Woman Is Shot in Brooklyn
description: A woman in her 90s was shot twice by a gunman in a moving car around sunset on Wednesday in the East New York section of Brooklyn, the police said.

title: Cuomo Calls for State to Return to Progressive Ideals
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, who spent his first two years in office establishing himself as a fiscal conservative, turned left in his third annual address to the Legislature, and sought to reclaim the states progressive mantle.

title: Lewis Follows in Fancy Footsteps, but Few Can Follow in His
description: OWINGS MILLS, Md.  With the fog machine on full blast before Sundays A.F.C. wild-card game at M&T Bank Stadium, Ray Lewis made his way onto the field to the symphonic renderings of the hip-hop artist Nelly. He reached down to grab a thick slab of sod and smashed it into his face.

title: Atop New York Senate, an Odd Couple With Some Issues
description: ALBANY  As Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo talked state of the state on Tuesday, the alternating presidents pro tem of the New York State Senate sat on the dais listening  two men who could not hide their I-swallowed-the-canary smiles.

title: Who Is Jack Lew?
description: NAME Jacob Joseph Lew, known as Jack

title: Police Say Suspect Planned to Blow Up Washington Arch
description: A man who was arrested last month on a charge of possession of a chemical explosive in his Greenwich Village apartment recently told acquaintances that he was busy making bombs to blow up Washington Arch, a police official said Wednesday.

title: Ailing on Court and Off, Lakers Lose Fifth Straight
description: SAN ANTONIO  The Los Angeles Lakers flew into Texas for two nights with a wounded lineup, forced to start a player who joined the team from the Development League.

title: In Harlem, a Nightspot So Iconic Theyll Reopen It. Twice.
description: A few short weeks ago, people in Harlem were wondering how the neighborhood would cope with the loss of the Lenox Lounge, where Dizzy Gillespie, John Coltrane and Billie Holiday once graced the stage, an authentic vestige of a bygone era.

title: Lottery Numbers
Isner Withdraws From Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  The top-ranked American John Isner pulled out of the Australian Open on Thursday, citing a bone bruise in his right knee.

title: Obama to Use King and Lincoln Bibles for Inaugural
description: When President Obama takes the public oath of office on Monday, Jan. 21  the federal holiday commemorating the birth of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.  he will use a Bible that belonged to the slain civil rights leader.

title: U.S. Consumer Watchdog to Issue Mortgage Rules
description: WASHINGTON  Banks and other lenders will be prohibited from making home loans that offer deceptive teaser rates or require no documentation from borrowers, and will be required to take more steps to ensure that borrowers can repay, under new consumer protections to be announced on Thursday.

title: Word of the Day | effigy
description: effigy \e-f-je\ noun

title: Rescuing Chinas Bears From Bile Farms, One by One
description: BEIJING  Some had wounded faces and bloodied paws. Some were angry after years of mistreatment.

title: Philanthropist Abandons Plan for Velodrome in Brooklyn Park
description: Eight months after it was first announced to the surprise and bewilderment of many New Yorkers, an improbable but well-financed plan to bring a bicycle racing track to Brooklyn Bridge Park has collapsed.

title: Whats on Thursday
description: 8 P.M. (NBC) 30 ROCK Jack (Alec Baldwin) forms an alliance with his rival Devin Banks (Will Arnett) in a scheme to discredit Kaylie Hooper (Chlo Grace Moretz), his teenage nemesis and the future chief executive of KableTown. Liz (Tina Fey) explores her options to become a mother. And Tracy (Tracy Morgan) tries to direct Octavia Spencer in his new movie. In The Office, at 9, Pam (Jenna Fischer) accidentally infects the office with lice but allows Meredith (Kate Flannery) to take the blame. Jim (John Krasinski) is having a great day in Philadelphia as he woos a possible business associate (Julius Erving). Phyllis (Phyllis Smith), Nellie (Catherine Tate) and Kevin (Brian Baumgartner) involve themselves in the love life of Darryl (Craig Robinson).

title: News Quiz | January 10, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: IHT Quick Read: Jan. 10
description: NEWS Bush fires raging across some of the most populous parts of Australia  feeding off widespread drought conditions and high winds  pushed firefighters to their limits and residents to their wits end on Wednesday as meteorologists tracked the countrys hottest spring and summer on record into uncharted territory. Months of record-breaking temperatures have produced what the government calls catastrophic conditions. Matt Siegel reports from Sydney.

title: In Indias Ancient Khajuraho, Eroticism Mingles With International Commerce
description: When you pass the sign that says Welcome to Khajuraho, you enter a different land. The roads become broad and smooth. Lush lawns and tall green trees line up on both sides of the street.

title: 3 Kurds Are Killed in Paris, in Locked-Door Mystery
description: PARIS  The three Kurdish women were murdered, two with bullets to the head, the third with a shot to the stomach. It was a carefully planned killing in a nondescript building in central Paris.

title: Test Yourself | English, Jan. 10, 2013
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article Even a Drive in the Suburbs Feels Like a 60s Vacation.

title: 2012 Was the Hottest Year on Record
description: In Not Even Close: 2012 Was Hottest Ever in U.S., Justin Gillis reports on the climate records set in the United States in 2012.

title: Echoes of Prayer and People
description: How do we live? How do we die? What do we think? Those are the questions that occupy Kenro Izu.

title: Betrayed by Basel
description: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Do Adults Who Are Only Trying to Help Sometimes Make Things Worse?
description: A recent study in the journal Pediatrics revealed that many overweight children felt bullied about their weight  not just by peers, but also by trusted adults, including coaches and parents.

title: Private Equity in China: Which Way Out?
description: HONG KONG  Welcome to the private equity game in China: you can buy in anytime you like, but you can never leave.

title: Ask a Financial Aid Expert About the Fafsa
description: As admission officers review the college applications that have flooded in by the Jan. 1 deadline, its time for those student applicants (and their parents) to submit what may be the most vital piece of their financial aid plans: the Free Application for Federal Student Aid, or Fafsa.

title: Help for Planning End-of-Life Care
description: If your 2013 resolution is to get your family to embark, finally, on advance care planning, you will find a valuable guide in a new Web site called Prepare.

title: Jets Widen Search for General Manager
description: The Jets, no closer to selecting their next general manager, have widened their search. Their latest pool of candidates, according to a person briefed on the search, includes Jerry Angelo, the former general manager of the Chicago Bears; Omar Khan, the Steelers director of business and football administration; and Brian Gaine, the Dolphins assistant general manager. Interviews will resume Thursday.

title: Visit by Google Chairman May Benefit North Korea
description: BEIJING  As a work of propaganda, the images that North Korea circulated this week showing Googles executive chairman, Eric E. Schmidt, touring a high-tech incubation center are hard to beat.

title: What to See on the London Stage in 2013
description: LONDON  With the new year come renewed theatrical hopes, which, in the case of London 2013, means having to equal the especially strong theater year just gone both for the classics (Shakespeare especially) and for new plays (the 2012 place to be on that front was the Royal Court).

title: Where Is the Indian Economy Headed?
description: Is Indias economy bottoming out, or getting worse?

title: Q&A: How to Reinstall the Google Chrome Browser
description: Q.

title: Pound for Pound
description: CAIRO  The crisis over the rushed adoption of Egypts new Constitution is costing President Mohamed Morsi. His popularity is down, and the country is more polarized than ever. Yet he should be even more worried about another crisis, largely of his own making: the recent run on the Egyptian pound, which is rapidly degrading an already precarious economic situation.

title: Two Very Different Stories of Murder, Faith and Forgiveness
description: This week the magazine features a story, Can Forgiveness Play a Role in Criminal Justice? about parents whose deeply held religious faith leads them to forgive  and seek a lesser sentence for  their daughters murderer. The killer was no stranger to Kate and Andy Grosmaire; he was their daughters boyfriend and they loved him, which made forgiveness both difficult and necessary.

title: Divisional Round Probabilities: Atlanta-Seattle Coin Toss Game
description: As seasons come to an end, the conventional assessments of team strength and some of the more advanced rankings tend to converge. Thats the case with the Seattle Seahawks this season. My model had them ranked sixth inthe league midway through the season, even as the Seahawks fell to a 4-4 record.

title: Selling a Business? Its the Details That Count
description: When we last left Holly Hunter, she had sold her business. She had received her down payment but the following payments had stopped after about a year. And it was obvious she had made some mistakes.

title: With Laos Disappearance, Signs of a Liberalization in Backslide
description: VIENTIANE, Laos  He was last seen driving home in his old, rusty jeep. And then he vanished.

title: The Delhi Gang Rape Accused: Vinay Sharma, a Quiet and Simple Boy
description: To keep her children warm on Wednesday night, Champa Devi tried to get a small fire going by puffing air into four pieces of wood outside their home in a South Delhi slum.

title: Returns at Hedge Funds Run by Women Beat the Industry, Report Says
description: Last year was fairly dismal for the hedge fund industry, almost any way you slice it.

title: Lincoln Leads Oscar Field With 12 Nominations
description: Start your Oscar Ballot here.

title: At Last, the Straw Bale House Is a  Home
description: The night we finished building it, we all sat on the floor of Allison Vanlonkhuyzens straw bale home and ate chili with her. Our four months of hard work volunteering for the nonprofit group Community Rebuilds were over.

title: The Last Man Asian Literary Prize
description: HONG KONG  The five shortlisted novels of what will be the last Man Asian Literary Prize were announced last evening at the Man Groups offices here. The British investment firm will end its support of Asias most prominent literary prize after the final award is given at a black-tie dinner in March.

title: European Central Bank Leaves Key Rate Unchanged
description: FRANKFURT  The euro zone economy shows signs of stabilizing and may even be in a period of positive contagion, Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, said on Thursday after the bank left its main interest rate at a record low.

title: Quasi Inauguration for Chvez in Venezuela
description: Venzuelas presidential inauguration is missing a president.

title: In His Comfort Zone
description: SEEING Ethan Hawke perched on a folding chair in a grungy Midtown rehearsal space leading actors through a reading is a bit of a shock. Not that he is there: Mr. Hawke is a steady presence in the New York theater scene, and he is rehearsing Clive, a play about a 90s-era New York rocker gone very, very bad, in which he stars and directs.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: A Late-Night Ratings Race, and a Controversial Puppeteer Resigns
description: It was Jimmy Kimmel who joined the 11:35 p.m. late-night sweepstakes with Jay Leno and David Letterman on Tuesday, but it was Mr. Leno who won the nights ratings race. Mr. Leno on NBC pulled in 3.27 million viewers, edging Mr. Kimmel on ABC, who had 3.1 million. The total for Mr. Kimmel was his second highest. It also put him in second place, ahead of David Letterman on CBS, who had 2.88 million viewers. As Bill Carter reports, Mr. Leno was also the winner in the audience of most interest to late-night advertisers  viewers between the ages of 18 and 49. Mr. Leno had 1.084 million viewers in that group to 887,000 for Mr. Kimmel and 683,000 for Mr. Letterman.

title: The 2012 Patent Rankings: IBM on Top (Again), Google and Apple Surging
description: In the yearly count of patents granted in the United States, the corporate front-runner for 2012 is scarcely a surprise.

title: App Smart Extra: More Options for Divers
description: Diving apps were this weeks subject for the App Smart column. If that seems a little unseasonal then you should remember that some great diving locations are in sunny spots, and a winter getaway vacation doesnt have to be about skiing!

title: Reversing Greeces free fall
description: Regarding Greeces rotten oligarchy (Views, Jan. 7): In citing the mendacity, corruption and avarice overrunning Athens, Kostas Vaxevanis describes a country whose political establishment has betrayed its citizenry. But the notion that modern-day Hellas can be revivified by a return to Greeces ancient democratic heritage is a chimera.

title: Lindsay Lohan in 'The Canyons'
description: A first look at "The Canyons," starring Lindsay Lohan and the porn star James Deen.

title: Opinion Report: The Hastert Rule
description: From the editorial page

title: Here Is What Happens When You Cast Lindsay Lohan in Your Movie
description: Lindsay Lohan moves through the Chateau Marmont as if she owns the place, but in a debtor-prison kind of way. Shell soon owe the hotel $46,000. Heads turn subtly as she slinks toward a table to meet a young producer and an old director. The actresss mother, Dina Lohan, sits at the next table. Mom sweeps blond hair behind her ear and tries to eavesdrop. A few tables away, a distinguished-looking middle-aged man patiently waits for the actress. He has a stack of presents for her.

title: Battle Lines Drawn Over Herbalife
description: BATTLE LINES DRAWN OVER HERBALIFE | The clash of the hedge fund titans has been set, and the financial world is eagerly watching. William A. Ackman and Daniel S. Loeb, two of the most prominent hedge fund managers in Manhattan, became business rivals on Wednesday, with hundreds of millions of dollars in play over Herbalife, a nutritional supplements company.

title: Gambling on a Crowded Subway Platform
description: Dear Diary:

title: Theories Link Paris Murders to Kurdish Peace Moves
description: LONDON  The overnight discovery in Paris of the  bodies of three Kurdish women activists prompted instant speculation that the execution-style triple killing was linked to an attempt to disrupt peace talks between Turkey and a jailed Kurdish guerrilla leader.

title: Herbalife Responds to Accusations From Hedge Fund
description: Herbalife found itself in a public relations nightmare in December when the hedge fund manager William A. Ackman called the company a pyramid scheme, announcing he was short-selling its shares. Since then, the stock has rebounded somewhat, and it got a lift on Wednesday when another hedge fund manager, Daniel S. Loeb, said he was bullish on Herbalife, which sells nutritional supplements and skin-care products through a network of independent distributors.

title: The Early Word: Fight Prep
description: In Todays Times:

title: Vain Glorious | Laura Merciers Caviar Stick Eye Color
description: For those of us who didnt snare any rose gold jewelry for the holidays, consider Laura Merciers new Caviar Stick Eye Color in rose gold as a consolation prize. Called Caviar because it glides on and is easy to use, the eyeliner has warm tones that seem to work on any skin color. Ive been wearing it during the day (its a total mood lifter) and when the sun goes down, adding a little extra, for a soft golden glow at cocktail hour. A luxe treat for $24.

title: In the Spirit of Ada Louise Huxtable, a Times Critic Reinvents His Role
description: Michael Kimmelmans piece on Ada Louise Huxtable, who died this week at age 91, in Tuesdays Arts section is tagged An Appraisal, but it could easily have been called something more enthusiastic: an appreciation. For by his own eager admission, Mr. Kimmelman  who took over as architecture critic in September 2011  owes much to Ms. Huxtable, whom he calls a role model.

title: Lincoln Leads Academy Award Nominations
description: Lincoln, Steven Spielbergs film starring Daniel Day-Lewis as the president of the United States who grappled with the scourge of slavery and the Civil War, was nominated for 12 Academy Awards on Thursday morning, including best picture, best director (for Mr. Spielberg) and best actor (for Mr. Day-Lewis). The other films nominated for best picture were Beasts of the Southern Wild, Silver Linings Playbook, Zero Dark Thirty, Les Misrables, Life of Pi, Amour, Django Unchained and Argo.

title: Cerberus to Buy Albertsons Grocery Chain From Supervalu
description: An investor group led by Cerberus Capital Management agreed on Thursday to buy a number of grocery chains from Supervalu, including Albertsons, for about $3.3 billion.

title: What Were Reading
description: Esquire: McDonalds versus Italian pizza: is this war?  Jeff Gordinier

title: Director Snubs Point to a Threeway Race: Lincoln vs. Playbook and Pi
description: An Oscar race that could have gone in almost any direction suddenly has a shape, and its not one that anyone was expecting. The shutout of Kathryn Bigelow and Ben Affleck for best director  though their movies, Zero Dark Thirty and Argo, were nominees for best picture and screenplay as well as for performances  will cause much hand-wringing around Hollywood, where both were considered locks, especially after they earned nods from the Directors Guild. Tom Hooper, the director of Les Misrables, was skipped over too, though his film had a high number of nominations.

title: Edward St. Aubyn: By the Book
description: If the author of the Patrick Melrose novels could meet any character from literature, he would choose Isabel Archer. And then hed propose marriage.

title: What Chris Christie Didnt Say
description: All three tri-state area governors gave their annual state of the state speeches this week. Two of them  Democrats Andrew Cuomo of New York and Dannel Malloy of Connecticut  discussed the weapons epidemic that was brought into such ghastly focus by the shootings in Newtown, Conn. Mr. Cuomo actually called for major legislation to restrict ownership of assault-style weapons and high-capacity magazines.

title: Drug Agency Recommends Lower Doses of Sleep Aids for Women
description: WASHINGTON  For two decades, millions of Americans have taken Ambien to help them sleep at night. But for years, the Food and Drug Administration has gotten complaints that people felt drowsy the morning after taking the medicine or its successors, and sometimes got into car accidents.

title: Seau Suffered From Brain Disease
description: The former N.F.L. linebacker Junior Seau had a degenerative brain disease linked to repeated head trauma when he committed suicide in the spring, the National Institutes of Health said Thursday.

title: I Dont Want My Preschooler to Be a Gentleman
description: My 4-year-old son, Emmett, swallows a spoonful of cereal and asks me if I know what a gentleman is. Surprised, I tell him I have some idea; then I ask what the word means to him.

title: Poetry Pairing | Bleak Weather
description: This weeks Poetry Pairing matches Bleak Weather, a poem by Ella Wheeler Wilcox with A Cool Glide Through Maine by Eric Hansen.

title: Photos of The Moment | E. Tautz
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: A Statement on Steroids, but What Does It Say?
description: Perhaps the most remarkable thing about the great Hall of Fame shutout of 2013 is, no matter which way the election voting had gone on Wednesday, the outrage would have sounded remarkably similar. Todays injustice  that the Hall of Fame path of some of the games greatest players, led by Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens, was blocked at least for now in the name of protesting the steroids era  would have been replaced by the injustice of ignoring the steroids era. The Halls credibility, now under attack for omitting such obvious superstars, would have been assailed for welcoming players everyone believes cheated the game on a massive scale.

title: Daily Report: Google Chief Urges North Korea to Embrace Web
description: Eric E. Schmidt, the executive chairman of Google, returned from a four-day visit to North Korea on Thursday with a message for the reclusive nations young new leader: embrace the Web or else, reports Andrew Jacobs of The New York Times.

title: Celeste Bartos, New York Philanthropist, Dies at 99
description: Celeste Bartos, a philanthropist who supported some of New York Citys most esteemed cultural institutions, in particular the New York Public Library and the Museum of Modern Art, died last Friday at her home in Manhattan. She was 99.

title: Every Wich Way
description: For something that has almost unlimited potential, the sandwich has become staid and unimaginative. In part this is because we dont have as many leftovers as we once did (we dont cook as much), so a meatloaf sandwich is nowhere near as common as it once was. But its mostly because weve allowed sandwich-making to become something that is either done by someone else or a task to be squeezed in between breakfast and taking the kids to the bus.

title: Sally Field, on Texting With Abraham Lincoln
description: Sally Field has been reluctant to say goodbye to Mary Todd Lincoln. She wont leave, not for a long time, Ms. Field said this morning, from a hotel in Los Angeles. But as a newly minted best supporting actress nominee, playing the wife to Daniel Day-Lewiss Lincoln, she can relive her performance for weeks to come.

title: British Panel Castigates Ex-UBS Officials at Hearing
description: LONDON  Several former senior executives at UBS were labeled negligent and incompetent on Thursday for failing to detect illegal activity that caused the Swiss bank to pay a $1.5 billion fine to global regulators.

title: Worrying About Electronic Benefits Deadline? Dont
description: March 1 is the deadline set by the federal government for converting all benefits payments  including Social Security  to electronic deposits.

title: France Considers a Gay Marriage Bill as Marriage Itself Is in Decline
description: PARIS French President Franois Hollande campaigned on a pledge to legalize gay marriage, though it drew little attention at the time, and he now has the votes in Parliament to do it.

title: California Suggests Mobile App Privacy Guidelines
description: Make your privacy policy readable. Avoid collecting data that you dont need for the app to function normally. Alert users with enhanced measures if third parties are collecting information, including for advertising.

title: From Homeless Teen to Oscar-Nominated Film Subject
description: 4:35 p.m. | Updated  Sean Fine was preparing a film for Sundance when he learned on Thursday that the documentary short he and his wife, Andrea Fine, had directed  Inocente, which was shown on MTV this summer  had been nominated for an Oscar.

title: Syria Denounces U.N. Envoy as Biased
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrias government appeared to distance itself from further engagement with the special peace envoy of the United Nations and the Arab League on Thursday, declaring him flagrantly biased even as his efforts aimed at a political transition to end the nearly two-year-old Syrian conflict were accelerating.

title: The Choice Blogger Graduates
description: I have been fortunate to work as a journalist at The New York Times for more than 24 years, beginning just after I graduated from college.

title: No Words Says It All
description: A lot has been written about the absence of words on the front page of The New York Timess sports section today in its coverage of the Hall of Fame vote. For those readers who have not seen the print edition, we thought we would present a copy of the page here.

title: Chvez Illness Delays Inauguration
description: TimesCast: The swearing-in of Hugo Chvez is delayed. | Baseball Hall of Fame voters reject steroid-tainted candidacies.

title: A Bit of Relief on Food Prices
description: World food prices ended the year with a slight decline, and for 2012 as a whole they were 7 percent below prices of 2011, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations reported on Thursday.

title: Hagels Confirmation Proceedings Will Be Short on Old Senate Allies
description: WASHINGTON  For a man who spent 12 years in the Senate, Chuck Hagel will find himself with few close allies when the Armed Services Committee takes up his nomination to be secretary of defense this month.

title: The Geopolitics of Soap Operas
description: KARACHI  With news in Pakistan seemingly going from bad to worse, no wonder people here are increasingly turning to the frivolous and titillating world of soap operas. The more foreign the better.

title: Thursday Reading: Flu Is Widespread This Year
Minister Backs Out of Speech at Inaugural
description: WASHINGTON  The minister selected by President Obama to deliver the benediction at his inaugural withdrew Thursday from the program, putting a quick end to a developing controversy over a sermon he gave in the 1990s in which he called on Christians to fight the aggressive agenda of the gay-rights movement.

title: Finding Hope After Miscarriage
description: One year I was pregnant four times. I was 38 and newly married. I got pregnant the first time in January. A few weeks later, I miscarried.

title: Honda to Assemble 2014 Accord Hybrid in Ohio
description: Honda says it will begin assembling a new 2014 Honda Accord Hybrid at a plant in Marysville, Ohio, later this year.

title: 2013 Academy Awards  The Nominees
description: A look at the Oscar nominations in top categories.

title: With Apologies to John Hawkes and Marion Cotillard
description: Pity poor John Hawkes. Mr. Hawkes endured weeks of discomfort  and perhaps permanent back damage  to play the polio-stricken writer Mark OBrien in The Sessions, only to be snubbed by the Academy for best actor. His co-star Helen Hunt, playing a sex therapist in a deeply felt performance that has her frequently naked, did earn the attention of the Academy, though. (Mr. Hawkes may get a chance to go to the ceremony though: he appears in Lincoln; then again so do hundreds of other actors.)

title: Sifting Out Sandy
description: In the Rockaways, truckloads of sand containing debris from Hurricane Sandy are emptied into huge sand-sifting machines. The sand is filtered, then returned to build up damaged seafronts.

title: Columbus Circle Subway Station, 10:48 A.M.
Forced Entry
description: The only time in my life Ive ever participated in a break-in was a few years ago, when my wife and I were still living in Dupont Circle. The safely gentrified D.C. neighborhood was hardly a felonious hive. But there were pockets of criminality in that garden of yuppie complacency, and our unloved, rent-controlled building was one of them.

title: A Great Year in Film
description: Melena Ryzik discusses this year's biggest successes and themes in her preview of the Academy Awards.

title: Ben Horowitz on the Impact of Software Everywhere
description: Ben Horowitz may have the skeleton key to the decimation  sorry, transformation  of our economic and political lives. What he doesnt have is a good sense of what we will look like when we get to the other side.

title: Look of The Moment | Taylor Swift
description: The Look: White Out. A plunging neckline turns a borderline bridal look into a ravishing red-carpet statement. With hair swept up and earrings dangling low, all eyes go straight to the face.

title: Lawyer Says Indian Gang Rape Suspect Was Tortured by Police
description: NEW DELHI  A lawyer defending one of the six young men accused in a gang rape case that has gripped India claimed on Thursday that his client had been tortured by the police and that his confession had been coerced.

title: A Boy's Silence Is Broken
description: Vladimir Gongora, a deaf teen from rural El Salvador, came to New York in May. Since then, he has begun learning to sign, read and write, and has started to make friends for the first time.

title: Simon Rattle to Leave Berlin Philharmonic in 2018
description: BERLIN  Simon Rattle will step down as chief conductor of the Berlin Philharmonic when his contract expires in 2018, the orchestra said on Thursday. Mr. Rattle, who came to Berlin in 2002 after 18 years spent conducting the City of Birmingham Orchestra in England, made the announcement so far in advance, he said, to give the orchestra time to find a new conductor.

title: F.C.C. Says Failure of 911 in Storm Was Preventable
description: WASHINGTON  Two days before a fast-moving, powerful windstorm swept across the mid-Atlantic last June, Verizon tested the backup power generator at its central office in Arlington, Va., and it failed.

title: The Spectacular Rise and Fall of Fitz John Porter
description: On Jan. 10, 1863, a military tribunal of nine Union generals found Maj. Gen. Fitz John Porter guilty of two charges stemming from his actions at the Second Battle of Manassas the previous August. Eleven days later, Porter was dismissed from the Army and forever disqualified from holding any office or trust or profit under the Government of the United States. After signing the order cashiering Porter, President Lincoln remarked, In any other country but this, the man would have been shot. His uncharacteristically harsh assessment reveals the controversy and political machinations that surrounded Porters court martial as well as the lingering drama accompanying the recent removal of his friend and patron, George McClellan, from command of the Union armies.

title: Swearing In Postponed for Ill Chvez
description: The Timess William Neuman reports on the quasi-presidential inauguration in Venezuela that President Hugo Chvez is unable to attend.

title: A Loss in the Family
description: SPECIAL POST  It is with great sadness that Wordplay announces the death of George Bredehorn, long-time constructor of the Split Decisions Variety puzzles. Mr. Bredehorn was 85 years old.

title: London Mens Fashion Week Fall 2013 Accessories
description: Highlights from the mens collections, from face masks to over-sized earmuffs.

title: Ang Lee on the Digital Characters Who Cant Argue Back
description: Life of Pi, the sweeping 3-D fantasy based on the 2001 international best-selling novel, defied many Oscar predictions by netting 11 nominations, second only to Steven Spielbergs Lincoln. In addition to the expected showing of Pi in the technical categories and a best picture nod, the film about shipwreck survival, religious wonder and a ferocious digital tiger named Richard Parker also drew a best directing nomination for Ang Lee.

title: Baseball Writers Select No One for Hall
description: Voters for the Hall of Fame emphatically rejected the candidacies of Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens in balloting results announced Wednesday.

title: Tough Path Seen by Obama on Ban of Assault Weapons
description: WASHINGTON  While President Obama pledged to crack down on access to what he called weapons of war in the aftermath of last months schoolhouse massacre, the White House has calculated that a ban on military-style assault weapons will be exceedingly difficult to pass through Congress and is focusing on other measures it deems more politically achievable.

title: Justin Timberlake Signals That Hes Ready. Just Not Yet.
description: Whats the best way for a pop star to get a quick tide of digital ink about a new album?

title: Amy Adams, Scared by Her Own Character
description: By now, youd think that Oscar nominations would be all in a good nights sleep for Amy Adams. After earning best supporting actress nods for Junebug (2005), Doubt (2008) and The Fighter (2010), Ms. Adams has received another shout-out, this time for Paul Thomas Andersons film The Master, playing Peggy Dodd, the submissive wife of a charismatic religious leader (Philip Seymour Hoffman) who eventually shows her husband whos boss with a rather steely hand.

title: Image of the Day: Jan. 10
With Daisy, Beats Electronics Bets on Digital Music
description: Memo to Spotify: Beats Electronics is coming for you.

title: Toronto Shows Faith in Nelsen
description: Ryan Nelsen has become accustomed to overcoming adversity. The New Zealand native encountered a major hurdle early in his collegiate playing days before landing at D.C. United in Major League Soccer and subsequently progressing to Englands Premier League.

title: Nokia Has Some Good News After Two Years of Gloom
description: Nearly two years ago, Stephen A. Elop, Nokias new chief executive, spoke of flaming ocean platforms and shark-infested waters to describe the problems he inherited as the company teetered on the brink of irrelevance.

title: A Persistent Foreign Predator, Dangerous but Delicious
description: Luiz Rocha, the curator of ichthyology at the California Academy of Sciences, writes from Belize, where he conducts research on the social wrasse, one of the worlds most endangered fish.

title: Baseball to Expand Drug-Testing Program
description: WASHINGTON  A day after suffering through the embarrassment of seeing no new players selected to the Hall of Fame, Major League Baseball and its players union moved ahead Thursday by announcing that they had reached an agreement to expand their drug-testing program.

title: When the Doctor Returns to Doctoring
description: Several years ago, a highly respected medical expert I had just met shared a little-known detail of his illustrious career: as a young doctor, he had stopped practicing medicine for a few years to homeschool his son.

title: The Extent of the Fires
description:
A map of the wildfires and an update of the status of the firefighting efforts.
Some small fires may not appear on the map due to the limitations of satellite sensors.

title: The Peoples Love for Chvez Continues
description: While President Hugo Chvez of Venezuela lies ill in Cuba, his many fans still flock to the streets at home in support.

title: Theater Talkback:  Familiar Faces in Two Dimensions
description: Between Al Pacino and Frankensteins monster, my life was a theater-free zone. In the last month of last year, I saw Mr. Pacino chomping up the Schoenfeld Theater on Broadway in David Mamets Glengarry Glen Ross; and in the first month of this year, I watched several versions of Mary Shelleys big man-made galoot chomping up the Kitchen, the performance space in Chelsea, in Radioholes Inflatable Frankenstein.

title: Obamas Chief of Staff Pick Is Said to Be Down to 2
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama on Thursday publicly acknowledged the big problem that he has created for himself by picking for the next Treasury secretary Jacob J. Lew, his trusted White House chief of staff. The shift left a vacancy in one of his administrations, and Washingtons, most powerful if least understood jobs.

title: For Anne Hathaway and Hugh Jackman, a Bittersweet Day
description: Anne Hathaway was humming. There was a brief, unexpected lull in her retinue of press calls this morning, and Ms. Hathaway was on hold, with a tune stuck in her head. And it was not exactly musical theater.

title: How Are You Warding Off the Flu?
description: Sure, you could go out and get a flu shot like everyone keeps telling you to do. Its relatively cheap, and available just about everywhere.

title: Britney Spears Said to Be Leaving The X Factor
description: Britney Spears will not return for another season of The X Factor, TMZ and The Hollywood Reporter said Thursday, opening up another chair at the judges table on the Fox singing competition.

title: Whats at the Center of the Debate Over Herbalife
description: In the wake of the bombshell announcement that Daniel S. Loebs Third Point has taken an 8.9 percent stake in Herbalife after the companys shares were shorted by William A. Ackman of Pershing Square, the question is: Which very rich hedge fund manager is right?

title: Before Rebuilding Beaches, Plucking Debris From Storm-Tossed Sand
description: Hurricane Sandys toll  already well-documented in power failures, forced evacuations and insurance losses  can also be measured in grains of sand.

title: Strike on Broadway
description:
Members of Local One, the stagehands' union, were on strike, closing many Broadway shows.
Hear from the people affected by the strike.

title: London Top 5
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Undocumented Reformers
description: Despite the risk of deportation, undocumented immigrants in Arizona are organizing to influence the pending debate on immigration reform in Washington, D.C.

title: Candidates in a Box
description: A subjective look at the gifts and deficits of the 2008 presidential hopefuls. By David Brooks and Ben Schott.

title: State of the Union
description: Interactive video and transcript of President Bush's State of the Union address.

title: Clouds Seen in Regulators Crystal Ball for Banks
description: Five years ago, the financial regulators of the United States  and more broadly the world  didnt see the storm coming.

title: How the Pentagon Spread Its Message
description: Audio, video and documents that show how the militarys talking points were disseminated.

title: Fed Profit of $88.9 Billion Sent to Treasury in 2012
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve said on Thursday that it sent $88.9 billion in profit to the Treasury Department in 2012, a record that reflected the vast expansion of the central banks investment portfolio.

title: Judge Blocks Restaurant Plan for Union Square Park
description: What is the purpose of a park? To eat? To eat $18 eggs and potatoes? Or is it to play? To leave space open for the public to gather in protest or celebration?

title: Despite Recent Losses, India Has an Edge in Upcoming Cricket Series
description: The mood is somewhat despondent in the Indian camp on the eve of the much-awaited cricket series of five One-Day Internationals against England, the first of which will be played in Rajkot on Friday.

title: Cyberstalkers Threaten Pipeline Security
description: In a recent annualreview, a team at the Department of Homeland Security that works to counter the threat of attacks on critical computer infrastructure counted 198 incidents in fiscal 2012. The events reported ranged from the use of malware to sabotage systems to phishing attacks for retrieving sensitive information. In roughly 40 percent of those cases, the target was the energy sector  an alarming rate, the report said.

title: Did Zeitlin Take Bigelows Spot?
description: LOS ANGELES  Hollywood is rarely surprised by Oscar nominations any more. All of the prognostication machinery that has grown up around the race has made sure of that. Even when a dark horse slips into the mix, the bumped contender is almost always a vulnerable one.

title: Carbon Emissions Across the United States
description: There are big differences in emissions between companies, and from state to state, that may make it harder to reach agreements on cuts.

title: Excerpt: 'The Other Place'
description: Laurie Metcalf and Zoe Perry in a scene from Sharr Whites play, which opened on Broadway at the Samuel J. Friedman Theater.

title: Downturn Still Squeezes Colleges and Universities
description: An annual survey of colleges and universities found that a growing number of schools face declining enrollment and less revenue from tuition.

title: New School Show Tunes
description: Listen to excerpts from In the Heights, Passing Strange, Adding Machine and A Catered Affair.

title: From Sketch to Stage: Dressing Dickens
description: David Zinn talks about the costumes he designed for A Tale of Two Cities.

title: Milestones: W. Mark Felt
description: An interactive timeline of W. Mark Felts career.

title: New Mortgage Rules Left Out Down Payments
description: New rules announced Thursday by the federal Consumer Financial Protection Bureau aim to shield borrowers from the risky sorts of mortgages that helped cause the recent financial crisis.

title: A Genre Boy Returns to Television
description: Cult favorite writer and director Joss Whedon answered reader questions about past projects and his new Fox series, Dollhouse.

title: On Second Night in New Slot, a Ratings Slide for Kimmel
description: Not that anyone should have expected Jimmy Kimmel to stage an immediate late-night ratings coup, but on his second night in a head-to-head-to-head contest with Jay Leno and David Letterman, Mr. Kimmel fell slightly in the ratings, while both other hosts added viewers.

title: David O. Russells Pre-Emptive Thank-You
description: The usually loquacious David O. Russell was rendered speechless, he said, by his nomination for best director and best adapted screenplay, not to mention the best picture nod, for Silver Linings Playbook.

title: Scene City: Girls Premieres Second Season
description: Cast members and fans of Girls fete the shows second season with a touch of (imported) Brooklyn.

title: The Sell: Reasons to Be Pretty
description: A closer look at the evolution of the poster art for Neil LaButes Broadway play.

title: Plenty of Guts, Little Glory
description: Many stars have had residencies on ER, but its the off-camera veterans who have kept the hospital humming throughout the shows 15-year run.

title: A Closer Look at Immigration Reform
description: TimesCast Politics: Activists speak out in Arizona. | An interview with a conservative voice. | Can legislation actually pass the House?

title: What Is a Guy?
description: An interactive look at craps, Automats and other references in the revival of Guys and Dolls.

title: Protesters From Afar
description: Political awakening in Russia has reached the immigrant population in the United States. New York activists organized a series of protests in the community not known for political activism.

title: Where Are They Now?
description: A look at Bush administration lawyers who advised the government on interrogation and national security.

title: Terrorists No Match for Single City Cop
description: Early in The Intercept, the serviceable debut thriller from the Law & Order creator Dick Wolf, Osama Bin Laden appears, reproaching his followers for recent failures. Bomb this. Bomb that, he scolds the men, sounding like an ad executive in a branding meeting. Nothing original, nothing intelligent, adding, We have failed to innovate.

title: The End Is Near!
description: Previews of eight of the seasons most anticipated finales, with an eye to which questions theyll answer  and which ones they probably wont.

title: There Was Even a Snub in the Foreign Language Category
description: This was a very, very good day for everyone associated with Amour, Austrias submission for the best foreign-language film Oscar. Amour was a lock for one of the five nominations in that category, but it also won four other nominations, in categories where the presence of foreign-language films is not common: best picture, best director (for Michael Haneke), best actress (for Emmanuelle Riva) and best original screenplay (for Mr. Haneke).

title: The Motor City Though the Camera Lens
description: The most publicized photographs of Detroit over the last few years have tended to be those of ancient factories and empty lots. Alternately celebrated as elegiac images of lost culture or derided as ruin porn, such images have obscured more subtle visions of the Motor City.

title: A Day of Conquests
description: Audio and photos from the all-day marathon of The Norman Conquests.

title: Clothes Make the Show
description: Costume designers for some of the most visually striking series on television discuss their work.

title: A History of Hall of Fame Shutouts
description: When the Hall of Fame voting for 2013 ended up in a big zero on Wednesday, it sparked a debate over how the stars of baseballs steroid era should be handled when it comes to enshrining them.

title: In Performance: TVs Best
description: Ginia Bellafante discusses some of the most notable performances of the year.

title: Pacific Tuna Stocks Have Plummeted, Scientists Warn
description: The Pacific bluefin tuna, fished relentlessly for decades, is in trouble.

title: Untangling Top Girls
description: Audience members share their thoughts on the Broadway production of Top Girls.

title: Emmanuelle Rivas Very Good Morning
description: Amours strong showing  five Oscar nominations for Michael Hanekes film about an elderly French couple facing death  included a best actress nod for Emmanuelle Riva, at 85 the oldest actress nominee in Academy history.

title: Competing Stimulus Bills
description: Key differences between the $838 billion economic recovery plan outlined by the Senate and the $820 billion version that passed the House.

title: More On a Quest for Common Ground on Climate Change
description: In 2011, I wrote about efforts by two scientists with different political orientations to identify common ground in weighing risks posed by global warming driven by greenhouse gases.The scientists werePeter C. Frumhoff, an ecologist who directs science and policy for the Union of Concerned Scientists, andKerry Emanuel, a veteran climate and hurricane researcher at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. (Emanuel has a new edition of his short everymans guide to global warming, by the way.)

title: And in This Corner, the Boys of Girls
description: FOR a show that is, down to its title, about women, Girls pays a lot of attention to its boys. The male characters  boyfriends, exes, bosses, frenemies  are fleshed out in a way thats unusual for an ensemble comedy, especially one aimed at the other gender. (How long did audiences have to wait for Mr. Bigs mere name on Sex and the City?)

title: A New Normal Star Thrives in the TV Ensemble
description: NOT all of the boys of Girls fit in with the Brooklyn crew. Andrew Rannells, a longtime New York theater actor, plays Elijah, Hannahs gay ex-boyfriend. Mr. Rannells, 34, who lives in the East Village, also stars in The New Normal, the NBC sitcom about a gay couple trying to have a child via surrogate. He saw his career blossom after he appeared on Broadway in The Book of Mormon. These are excerpts from his conversation with Melena Ryzik.

title: The Edges Are Still Sharp in Brooklyn
description: Back when networks reigned supreme, cable television was the place to go for sex and violence. Now its also a safe house for pessimism, an alternate universe where problems fester or deepen, friends let one another down, and love doesnt conquer anything.

title: Points for Every (Bumpy) Lap
description: ROLLER skating was as big a part of local culture as bowling in New Jersey, where Elizabeth Schwartz grew up. She laughs when she says she is not the most athletic person in the world, though she is game for pretty much any sport. And now that includes roller derby.

title: Cuomos State of the State Address
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo delivered his State of the State address in Albany on Wednesday.

title: Creative Use of White Space in Sports  Discuss
description: Readers who picked up Thursdays print edition and turned to the Sports section could be forgiven if they did a double-take or choked on their morning coffee. For what they saw on the front page of the section was  well, nothing. Or actually, almost nothing: The page was more than three-quarters blank, topped with a headline, in most editions, that read And the Inductees Are

title: Art House | Wendell Castle
description: The American designer Wendell Castle is known for his idiosyncratic, organic and slightly surreal furniture, which he has been producing in laminated wood, plastic and other materials since the 1960s, and which is highly collectible. Castle, who turned 80 in 2012, showed his work at Design Miami last month, and today his exhibition A New Environment opens at Friedman Benda in Chelsea. (Another Castle show, Volumes and Voids, is on view just upstairs from Friedman Benda at the Barry Friedman Gallery through Jan. 26.)

title: Flights Screenwriter Is Just Thrilled His Name Was Pronounced Right
