description: The audible nudge, wafting above the tracks, is probably familiar to any New York City subway rider: Please stand away from the platform edge.

title: Camby Adds Foot Injury to Knicks List of Woes
description: The Knicks found themselves short-handed again Friday night when they announced that Marcus Camby would be out two to four weeks with a foot injury, a painful reminder of just how fragile the oldest team in the N.B.A. can be.

title: Answers to Questions About New York
description: A Scary Street

title: Cornell Withdraws Recognition of a Fraternity After a Report of Hazing
description: Two years after one of its students died after a fraternity drinking ritual, Cornell University has withdrawn its recognition of another fraternity after a pledging episode in which prospective members were said to have been served alcohol and stripped naked.

title: Lottery Numbers
Tusks of Whimsical-Looking Whales Lead to Charges for 2 in a Maine Courtroom
description: BANGOR, Me.  Two Americans on Friday pleaded not guilty to charges that they participated in a decade-long international smuggling operation that, according to federal officials, brought narwhal tusks  the long, tapered tooth that makes the elusive Arctic creature look a bit like a floating unicorn  into the United States.

title: For Nets, Third Quarters the Charm Again
description: Nets Coach P. J. Carlesimo did not say much to his team at halftime, but he thought this might be a game to throw in the towel early. The Nets trailed the Phoenix Suns by 7 points, and they looked lifeless. He implored his players for more energy.

title: He Snips, He Flirts, He Stays
description: ASTOR PLACE HAIRSTYLISTS has gone through many changes since it became, in the early 1980s, the renowned East Village hip haircut factory, but one constant has been Valentino Gogu, 65, who has been cutting hair at the shop for nearly three decades.

title: Fund-Raising Is Lagging, So Far, for Inaugural Plans
description: President Obamas inaugural committee is at least $10 million short of its $50 million fund-raising goal, officials have told top donors, with just over a week before Mr. Obama is sworn in for his second term.

title: Local Stop: South Street Seaport
description: The South Street Seaport was once the bustling, raucous, polyglot center for maritime trade in the Port of New York.

title: Winter Jazzfest: Worth the Wait for a Marquee Duo
description: I encountered my first line  the first of many, if past precedent counts for anything  outside the Bitter End, for a duo set by the guitarists Nels Cline and Julian Lage. I eventually made it inside, and was glad that I did.

title: Veterans and Senate Buddies, Until Another War Split Them
description: WASHINGTON  In the old days it was like a Senate buddy movie.

title: A Sinner Holds Tight to Faith and a Second Chance
description: OWINGS MILLS, Md.

title: Water and Land, Past and Present
description: The South Street Seaport was once the bustling, raucous, polyglot center for maritime trade in the Port of New York. During its peak years, in the half century after the War of 1812, ships from all over the world docked here, with their bowsprits pointing west over South Street. But the areas proximity to the East River led to terrible flooding during Hurricane Sandy, and the historic neighborhood, much of it built on 19th-century landfill, is only beginning to recover.

title: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, Jan. 12, 2013
description: If I had 1,000 AR-15s I could sell them in a week.

title: Ruth Carter Stevenson of the Amon Carter Museum Dies at 89
description: Ruth Carter Stevenson, who followed her fathers last wishes in creating the Amon Carter Museum in Fort Worth, one of the nations pre-eminent collections of American art, died on Jan. 6 at her home in Fort Worth. She was 89.

title: Media Towers; Old Letters; and War Stories
description: A newspaper reporter once complimented Renzo Piano, the architect of The New York Times Building on Eighth Avenue, on his design, noting that the building reminded him of a sheet of newsprint. It does? Mr. Piano replied.

title: A Booster for Brooklyn, 7 Days a Week
description: After waking his parakeet, going out with his wife to walk and buy food, and eating breakfast, Marty Markowitz, the borough president, spends most Sundays appearing at events, in churches and before organizations.

title: In 2010 Portland Bomb Plot, a Question of Manipulation or Violent Extremism
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  A defense lawyer for a 21-year-old Somali-American told a federal jury here on Friday that his client did in fact push a cellphone button on a night in late November 2010 believing he was detonating a truck bomb that would kill hundreds or thousands of people who had gathered to watch downtown Portlands Christmas lights come on.

title: Jeanne Vertefeuille, C.I.A. Official Who Helped Catch a Notorious Mole, Dies at 80
description: Jeanne Vertefeuille joined the Central Intelligence Agency as a typist in 1954 and then began inching up through the ranks, obtaining postings overseas. By 1986 she had become a midlevel expert on the Soviet Union and counterintelligence. She remained a quiet agency soldier, however  purposefully nondescript and selflessly dedicated. She lived alone and walked to work.

title: Being Brooklyn, Aided by Cheesecake
description: Officially, Marty Markowitz may be Brooklyns borough president, but others know him as its booster-in-chief. Born three blocks from Ebbets Field and becalmed in the borough ever since, he spends every day  Sundays included  at ribbon cuttings, street renamings and political dinners, learning his constituents problems, doing whatever his City Charter-limited powers allow, and, always, cheering the borough. After 23 years as a state senator, he was elected to the job I always wanted in 2001. Now 67, he lives in a brick house in Windsor Terrace with his wife, Jamie, 54, a graphic artist; they have an African gray parrot named Beep (as in B.P.) that he calls his son.

title: Ex-Technician Denies Faulty DNA Work
description: A former New York City laboratory technician whose work on rape cases is now being scrutinized for serious mistakes said on Friday that she had been unaware there were problems in her work and, disputing an earlier report, denied she had resigned under pressure.

title: Rockefeller Will Leave Senate After Five Terms
description: WASHINGTON  Senator John D. Rockefeller IV of West Virginia, a longtime liberal voice in Congress, announced on Friday that he would not seek a sixth term in 2014, providing an opening for Republicans to cut into the Democratic Senate majority.

title: A Seemingly Familial Unit Visits Boutiques, Looking for New Jeans
description: Kate Johnson was helping a customer in the back of an Olive and Bettes boutique in SoHo when the front door opened on a recent Sunday afternoon. She looked up.

title: Sales of Guns Soar in U.S. as Nation Weighs Tougher Limits
description: As Washington focuses on what Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. will propose next week to curb gun violence, gun and ammunition sales are spiking in the rest of the country as people rush to expand their arsenals in advance of any restrictions that might be imposed.

title: Rejected Disability Claims in Queens May Be Reheard
description: Thousands of poor Queens residents with debilitating conditions who were denied federal disability benefits would have their cases reconsidered, under a settlement proposal in a class-action lawsuit that accused judges of bias.

title: Mother Learns a New Skill and How to Calm Her Child
description: All of her hours practicing on a stenograph keyboard have brought Stephanie VanBuren equal amounts of insight and frustration, reassurance and doubt.

title: The Unaffordable Luxury of Food
description: Sometime around 1990 and not too long out of college, I held what memory tells me was my first true dinner party, in a three-bedroom brownstone duplex in Brooklyn, where the rent was approximately $1,200 a month. The menu revolved around a pork loin stuffed with sausage and dried apricots, a recipe that came from The New Basics, which along with The Silver Palate Cookbook, its predecessor, and the various musings of Laurie E. Colwin would have made up the near entirety of any young aspiring cooks kitchen library. That evening, we were paying tribute to a friend who had recently begun working as a writer for David Letterman, and in that spirit my roommate and I purchased several bottles of Kendall-Jackson chardonnay for $11 each, feeling very grand about it.

title: Out of Sorts Once Again, Knicks Fall to the Bulls
description: The Chicago Bulls did not need to bully the Knicks. They did not need to slow the game down, either. In the third meeting of the season between the teams, the Bulls were dominant.

title: Lawmaker Seeks Public Reply on Guns
description: SANTA ROSA, Calif.  A California congressman leading a House Democratic task force on gun violence wrapped up a series of heated and packed town hall meetings on gun control here Thursday night, providing a glimpse into how the debate is resonating beyond Washington after last months massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Conn.

title: Antique Cannon in Central Park Found Loaded
description: The cannons of the British warship H.M.S. Hussar were last fired in anger during the Revolutionary War. But when Central Park Conservancy workers arrived to clean one on Friday, the police said, they found it was still loaded with gunpowder and a cannonball, ready to fire.

title: Justices to Hear Case on Groups Free Speech
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Friday agreed to decide cases on the First Amendment rights of groups fighting AIDS and the Fifth Amendment rights of people who refuse to answer questions from the police.

title: Kenojuak Ashevak, Artist From the Canadian Arctic, Dies at 85
description: OTTAWA  Kenojuak Ashevak, a once-nomadic artist from Canadas Arctic regions whose prints and drawings helped introduce Inuit art to much of the world, died on Tuesday at her home in Cape Dorset on West Baffin Island in the northern territory of Nunavut. She was 85.

title: Louisiana: New Orleans Rethinks Deal on Police
description: A federal judge in New Orleans on Friday approved a sweeping consent decree with the citys Police Department, one of the most ambitious blueprints for a police overhaul in the country in years. The agreement was announced last summer by officials from the city, the Police Department and the Justice Department, after two years of investigations and negotiations. But in a sign that the matter may be far from settled, Judge Susie Morgan of Federal District Court acknowledged in her order that the city intended to file a motion to withdraw from the deal. In a statement, Mayor Mitchell J. Landrieu said he wanted to hold off on the pact because he objected to the millions of dollars the city may have to spend under a separate agreement pertaining to the city jail, which is currently being negotiated. We asked the judge to hold off on executing the police consent decree until the price tag of the prison consent decree is clear, Mr. Landrieu said.

title: Photo Replay: Jan. 11
description: A view of the day in sports, from bobsledding to a friendly soccer match at a prison.

title: Ford Plans to Hire 2,200 Salaried Workers in U.S.
description: The Ford Motor Company said on Friday that it planned to hire 2,200 salaried workers in the United States this year, its largest increase in new salaried workers in more than a decade, to support new Ford product introductions. The hiring is in addition to the more than 8,100 combined hourly and salaried jobs Ford created in the United States in 2012, as the company increased production capacity and expanded engineering, manufacturing and other areas to meet the growing demand for its vehicles, the company said. About 1,000 of the positions are hourly jobs brought back to Ford plants in the United States from other locations, including Japan and Mexico. Ford said it was more than halfway to the 12,000 new jobs it committed to deliver in the United States by 2015 as part of its 2011 contract with the United Automobile Workers. As we expand our product lineup of fuel-efficient vehicles, we need more people in critical areas, such as in a range of engineering activities, vehicle production, computer software and other I.T. functions, to ensure we deliver the vehicles people want and value, Joseph R. Hinrichs, Fords president for the Americas, said in a news release.

title: Advanced Systems Are on the Move
description: New technologies are changing the way cars are driven.  John Markoff

title: Drivers With Hands Full Get a Backup: The Car
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  Driving around a college campus can be treacherous. Bikes and scooters zip out of nowhere, distracted students wander into traffic, and stopped cars and speed bumps suddenly appear. It takes a vigilant driver to avoid catastrophe.

title: Whats On Saturday
description: 8 P.M. (Showtime) THE TWILIGHT SAGA: BREAKING DAWN  PART 1 (2011) Bella Swan (Kristen Stewart) weds her vampire, Edward (Robert Pattinson, above, with Ms. Stewart), enjoys a rollicking honeymoon and then suffers through a horrendous pregnancy in this fourth installment in the franchise, directed by Bill Condon. Mr. Pattinsons portrayal of a passionate, potentially dangerous husband capable of sexual rough play shifts the story into another world, said Manohla Dargis, writing in The New York Times. Mr. Condon works in that world fluidly, gilding it with a necessary sense of humor  Bella and Edwards white honeymoon bed glows as portentously as an altar for a sacrificial virgin  and imbuing it with a love and a gift for melodrama. He slathers on the music (melodrama comes from song or music drama), lets Ms. Stewart rock and the emotions roil. He resurrects the awkward teenage yearning that enlivened the first Twilight movie, but also transforms that initial, crude hunger into something deeper. Mostly, he brings Bella toward her happily-ever-after by giving this movie over to her, her dreams and her desires, as in a cosmic montage sequence worthy of The Tree of Life, but, you know, shorter. Edward may finally change Bella, but its Mr. Condon who resurrects her.

title: Are They Gifted? Or Segregated?
description: The city says the testing for accelerated programs is fair but critics say it favors pupils who are already privileged, putting them on a fast track to success.

title: A Major Gap in Gifted Programs
description: Since 2009, the number of schools offering gifted programs has fallen, especially in minority areas of the city like central Brooklyn, southeast Queens and the Bronx.

title: Gifted, Talented and Separated
description: IT is just a metal door with three windows, the kind meant to keep the clamor of an elementary school hallway from piercing a classrooms quiet. Other than paint the color of bubble gum, it is unremarkable.

title: IHT Quick Read: Jan. 12
A Clear View of an Unfamiliar City
description: The street photographer Steven Siegel has captured a historical record of New Yorks battered past: its lunar beaches and junked appliances and citizens as shadows on the wall.

title: New Focus on Village of Delhi Rape Victims Father
description: MEDAWARA, Uttar Pradesh  A makeshift helipad was being built this week in this remote dusty village in eastern Uttar Pradesh. The potholed single-lane road that leads the village was under repair, and journalists, district officials and local politicians had come to call.

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Rajasthan: On Thursday, an additional district court in Rajasthan sentenced a man to capital punishment for the rape and murder of a minor, the Deccan Herald reported. The accused, a 28-year-old named Sohanlal, raped a 15-year-old girl in his neighborhood and then strangled her.

title: As Formula One Hibernates, Some Puzzlers to Ponder
description: PARIS Its the winter season, when nothing happens in Formula One. The last race of 2012 was on Nov. 25, in Brazil, and the first race of the 2013 season will take place on March 17, in Australia. But the presentation of the new cars starts later this month. Winter testing starts on Feb. 5 in Spain. And actually, a lot has been happening, some of it puzzling, or open to interpretation. Id like to take a break from the break and make short list of the principal such head-scratchers, and ask readers what they make of it all. In most cases, I am not quite sure what I make of it, but have some ideas, too.

title: Missing School for a Stint at the Australian Open
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Nicole Gibbs, a 19-year-old college junior who is an economics major at Stanford, wasnt about to make any financial decision without researching market conditions and past trends.

title: The Weekend Word: Political Divorce
description: Todays Times

title: French Soldier Killed in Somalia Commando Raid
description: PARIS  French special forces failed early Saturday in a hostage rescue mission in southern Somalia.

title: Jil Sander: Fall 2013 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Jil Sander
description: The show was one of the first during Milan Mens Fashion Week.

title: Project Basement: The Receiver
description: My search for a receiver is over.

title: Hostages Caught Up in Frances African Intervention
description: LONDON  The widespread satisfaction expressed in France at the governments decision to intervene militarily against Islamic militants in Mali was tempered on Saturday by news of a failed overnight French hostage rescue mission on the other side of Africa.

title: Credibility
description: Ah. Charles Plosser of the Philadelphia Fed is against the platinum coin, which he says doesnt solve any real problem and would hurt our credibility.

title: Why Am I a Challenge for Charities?
description: From top-notch schools to groups like Heifer International, charities want the same thing from baby boomers that they wanted from your parents and grandparents: money. The trouble is figuring out how to get it. Theres gold in them thar boomers, but how do you mine it?

title: Worthwhile Japanese Initiative
description: Shinzo Abe has taken Japan off in a surprisingly Keynesian direction. Noah Smith points out, again, that hes probably doing it for disreputable reasons, mainly old-fashioned LDP pork-barrel (katsu barrel? tofu barrel?) politics. But this may not matter.

title: Over 50, and Under No Illusions
description: ITS a baby boomers nightmare. One moment youre 40-ish and moving up, the next youre 50-plus and suddenly, shockingly, moving out  jobless in a tough economy.

title: Recalibrating a Directing Brotherhood
description: IN Broken City, a crime thriller by the director Allen Hughes, Mark Wahlberg plays Billy Taggart, a former New York policeman who suspects that his girlfriend (Natalie Martinez) is having an affair. Enraged, Billy gets so drunk that he hears the chorus of DMXs Party Up thumping in his ears, then goes completely bananas on the streets of the East Village.

title: Jil Sander: The Complexity of the Simple
description: MILAN  Steve Jobs once remarked that simple can be harder than complex. The thought was not particularly original or even original to him but, like pretty much everything else Jobs did, it had wide applications to a culture he helped define. According to the Apple calculus, simple equals idiot-proof and that equals success.

title: On Winfreys Show, Armstrong Is Planning to Confess Drug Use
description: After nearly 15 years of vehement denials, Lance Armstrong will admit that he used performance-enhancing drugs during his cycling career when he is interviewed by Oprah Winfrey, two people with knowledge of the situation said.

title: Dolce & Gabbana: Fall 2013 Menswear
description: Milan

title: In Cooperstown, a Crowded Waiting Room
description: The failure of the writers to pick Barry Bonds or Roger Clemens was not a surprise given the low vote totals received in the past by Mark McGwire and Rafael Palmeiro, other players associated with the use performance-enhancing drugs. But the vote totals for Bonds and Clemens, just 36 and 38 percent, were lower than expected.

title: Journalists in Greece Are Becoming Targets
description: The Greek police on Saturday were looking for the people responsible for detonating makeshift bombs at the homes of five journalists in Athens, the latest in a series of actions taken against reporters in Greece that have raised questions about a deteriorating climate for media freedom.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: With Elusive Victory in Sight, Retirement Talk Must Wait
description: FLOWERY BRANCH, Ga.  For Michael Palmer, breakfast consists of oatmeal with blueberries and cinnamon. Why not a higher-calorie meal for a strapping, energy-burning N.F.L. tight end?

title: In Fantasy Football, Refining the Search for Points
description: After finishing near the top of standard fantasy football scoring in each of the past four seasons, Green Bay quarterback Aaron Rodgers appeared more than worthy of his No. 2 average draft position (fantasypros.com) in this past seasons fantasy drafts.

title: A Desert Cold and Wet Multiplies the Misery of Syrian Refugees
description: ZAATARI, Jordan  The water has mostly been removed from hundreds of flooded tents and the dirt paths that run between them here in the regions vastest camp of Syrian refugees. The clotheslines are laden with soggy sweaters and socks, waiting for the sun after a week of harsh wind, rain and snow.

title: Variety: An Acrostic With Personality
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Heres another book to add to your reading list: THE MUSIC OF CHANCE, by PAUL AUSTER, a novel about the supposed meaninglessness of the universe. Published in 1990, it has since become a film starring Mandy Patinkin and James Spader, but Mr. Austers writing is so charming, youll want to read the book. Here is the New York Times review of the novel.

title: French Airstrikes in Mali Deter Islamist Rebels
description: PARIS  French airstrikes in Mali appeared to halt an Islamist rebel advance, France said Saturday, as West African nations authorized what they said would be a fast deployment of troops in support of the weak Malian government.

title: Sides Sign Agreement; Training Camps to Open
description: It took four months, and one more delay Saturday, but the N.H.L. and the players union put the final details in place to lift the lockout, allowing the league to reopen and prepare for its first games of the 2012-13 season this coming Saturday.

title: Dolce & Gabbana
description: Milan

title: Our Economic Pickle
description: FEDERAL income tax rates will rise for the wealthiest Americans, and certain tax loopholes might get closed this year. But these developments, and whatever else happens in Washington in the coming debt-ceiling debate, are unlikely to do much to alter one major factor contributing to income inequality: stagnant wages. For millions of workers, wages have flatlined. Take Caterpillar, long a symbol of American industry: while it reported record profits last year, it insisted on a six-year wage freeze for many of its blue-collar workers.

title: The Low Politics of Low Growth
description: WE typically blame Washington for not doing more to help the economy grow. But what if we have it backward: What if it is the weak economy that is driving the failures in Washington?

title: Dolce & Gabbana, Part 2
description: Milan mens fashion week, 2013.

title: Why Pixel Counts Dont Count in Cameras
description: With the coming of the Consumer Electronics Show, camera manufacturers will be trotting out scads of new products, but many are unfortunately falling back on an old marketing strategy.

title: Russian Lawmakers Aim at Foreign Cars, Films and Schooling in Patriotic Purge
description: MOSCOW  The members of Russias lower house of Parliament  which last year passed so many harsh new laws with so little debate that commentators compared it to a rabid printer  returned to work last week as the standard-bearers for President Vladimir V. Putins brand of patriotism.

title: For Patriots Coach and Quarterback, Wins, Not Words, Add Up
description: FOXBOROUGH, Mass.  Bill Belichick is excited. Really, he is. Or rather, he says he is. The sentiment must be qualified because anyone observing Belichicks news conference Friday  attended by a few dozen reporters and filmed by a row of cameras  can attest that he expressed it with all the emotion of a rutabaga.

title: Knicks and Anthony Remain Vulnerable to Self-Sabotage
description: It was almost half past 11 Friday night when Carmelo Anthony strolled into the public part of the locker room, about an hour after the Knicks third straight defeat to an Eastern Conference rival. This is now one of the defining measures of 21st-century N.B.A. stardom  the longer deadline-besieged reporters are kept waiting, the more important the player apparently must be.

title: Burberry Prorsum: Fall 2013 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Burberry
description: The changing demands of war  or the military, anyway  have generated almost all the major evolution in menswear.

title: As Texas Bakes in a Long Drought, Water Becomes a Focus for Legislators
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  There is usually no shortage of controversial and politically divisive issues for lawmakers to address in the opening days of a state legislative session, from abortion to immigration to gun rights.

title: Australian Open: Players to Watch
description: A look at some of the more intriguing players in this years Australian Open.

title: Two Men, One Sky
description: As they pursued a hang gliding record over hundreds of miles, Jonny Durand and Dustin Martin were often within shouting distance of each other.

title: A Hunters Education in the Class of 13
description: The environmental conservation officer stood in front of my hunter-education class and said he had never seen one so big, so early in the year. Normally in January he would be speaking to about a dozen people, maybe 20, most of them Boy Scouts. Our group numbered at least 70, most of them solitary men, from young to grizzled, but also a family with children and a handful of fathers with young daughters.

title: Salvagers in Italy Say Costa Concordia Wreck May Be Gone by Summers End
description: GIGLIO, Italy  One year after the luxury liner Costa Concordia ran aground off the Tuscan coast, taking 32 lives, its wreck still lies there, a lumbering hulk of metal enclosed by floating salvage platforms, creating an incongruous industrial landscape amid the pristine waters of a marine sanctuary.

title: Is Delhi So Different From Steubenville?
description: IN India, a 23-year-old student takes a bus home from a movie and is gang-raped and assaulted so viciously that she dies two weeks later.

title: Forget the Oscars  Its the Teachies!
description: After months of speculation, the nominations have finally been announced for the Teachies, the biggest, glitziest, most media-crazed pedagogical awards ceremony of the year, judged by the renowned American Federation of Teachers and presented in the legendary Student Drama Theater. Who will win Teacher of the Year? Or Best School? And dont forget the smaller awards, like Most Supportive Teaching Assistant. Read on for predictions to use for your office pool!

title: Fight for the Housing Trust Fund
description: Despite the Obama administrations best efforts, the lack of affordable housing remains one of Americas most vexing problems.

title: Syrian Camp Faces Storms Aftermath
description: Syrian refugees face harsh conditions at camp in Jordan.

title: Darwin Was Wrong About Dating
description: A COUPLE of evolutionary psychologists recently published a book about human sexual behavior in prehistory called Sex at Dawn. Upon hearing of the project, one colleague, dubious that a modern scholar could hope to know anything about that period, asked them, So what do you do, close your eyes and dream?

title: We Offer More Than Ankles, Gentlemen
description: WASHINGTON

title: Collaborate vs. Collaborate
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.

title: Restoring Due Process
description: The Supreme Court this week will consider whether to reverse a troubling 2002 decision that allowed judges greater sentencing power in certain circumstances. For the sake of fairness and consistency, it should overturn that 10-year-old ruling.

title: Misguided Social Security Reform
description: At the end of last year, just shy of the 11th hour in the fiscal cliff negotiations, President Obama made an offer that included a Republican-backed idea to cut spending by lowering the cost-of-living adjustment for Social Security benefits. The move shocked Congressional Democrats and dismayed Mr. Obamas liberal base.

title: Democrats Behaving Badly
description: FOR the textbook definition of not knowing enough to quit while youre ahead, please turn your attention to Harry Reid, he of the scabrous tongue and rotten temper, a boxer in his youth and a pugilist to this day, throwing mud along with punches and invariably soiling himself.

title: Venezuela Warns Opposition Against Vocal Dissent
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Top government officials are threatening to take action against opposition governors and issuing dark warnings about conspiracies against the government of President Hugo Chvez, who is ailing and remains incommunicado in Cuba.

title: A Pedophile in Plain Sight
description: JUST after Christmas, Poly Prep Country Day School, the venerable Brooklyn institution, settled a lawsuit alleging a more than 40-year cover-up of the predatory pedophilia of its legendary football coach, Philip Foglietta. The terms of the settlement have not been disclosed, but the lawsuit charged that school administrators were repeatedly informed from the 1960s until his forced retirement in 1991 that Mr. Foglietta was sexually abusing boys  on campus, in his apartment and during trips. Mr. Foglietta, who died in 1998, fondled and raped dozens, if not hundreds, of children.

title: 12-Year-Old Is Commentator, Would-Be G.M. and N.F.L. Trend
description: BALTIMORE  As the Ravens were losing three consecutive games in December, Cullen Little told his radio audience that the team should let quarterback Joe Flacco leave as a free agent.

title: Sunday Dialogue: Is a Bigger House Better?
description: Readers debate how to make Congress less dysfunctional.

title: The Obama Synthesis
description: AS both his critics and admirers argue, the nomination of Chuck Hagel as secretary of defense last week tells us something important about Barack Obamas approach to foreign policy. But so does the man who was nominated alongside Hagel, to far less controversy and attention: John Brennan, now head of the White Houses counterterrorism efforts, and soon to be the director of the C.I.A.

title: Jeffrey Sprecher
description: Jeffrey Sprecher is the founder and chief executive of IntercontinentalExchange, or ICE, an Atlanta-based operator of futures exchanges, credit markets and clearinghouses. He is currently awaiting regulatory approval to acquire the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Cuomo Declares Public Health Emergency Over Flu Outbreak
description: With the nation in the grip of a severe influenza outbreak that has seen deaths reach epidemic levels, New York State declared a public health emergency on Saturday, making access to vaccines more easily available.

title: When Markets Rise Above Politics
description: ECONOMIC growth remained sluggish and politics often intruded on the markets, yet stocks achieved solid returns last year all the same. It wasnt the first time that investors scaled a wall of worry, but it might be the only instance when the main source of concern, at least in the fourth quarter, was thought to be a cliff.

title: Internet Activist, a Creator of RSS, Is Dead at 26, Apparently a Suicide
description: Aaron Swartz, a wizardly programmer who as a teenager helped develop code that delivered ever-changing Web content to users and who later became a steadfast crusader to make that information freely available, was found dead on Friday in his New York apartment.

title: Burberrys Martial Menswear
description: War, huh, yeah, what is it good for? asked the lyrics to a 1970s hit by Edwin Starr. The answer: Absolutely nothing, uh huh! Thats not entirely true, though. The changing demands of war  or the military, anyway  have generated almost all the major evolution in menswear, particularly when it comes to the longest and most successful of male uniforms, the suit.

title: The Thinking Persons Entertainment
description: SOME of televisions most compelling shows start up again this month  and thank heaven for that. Downton Abbey, The Good Wife and Girls will happily draw viewers  like me  back into their characters and their plot-heavy story lines.

title: Speaking Like a Shaman, Running Like the Wind
description: HOUSTON  The question made Arian Foster think, which to him is precisely the point. Understand the universe, youll understand me, reads part of the profile on his Twitter account, so when Foster was asked whether he loves winning or hates losing, he answered like a shaman in search of spiritual balance.

title: Remembering Aaron Swartz
description: Last Updated, 9:02 p.m. Friends, colleagues and admirers of Aaron Swartz, a digital activist and innovator, posted tributes to him online on Saturday, after an early-morning report of his death by The Tech, the Massachusetts Institute of Technology student newspaper. An uncle, Michael Wolf, told The Times that Mr. Swartz, 26, had apparently committed suicide in New York on Friday.

title: Bryant Now Deals With Mediocrity
description: Albert Camus once wrote, There is scarcely any passion without struggle. Anyone who has watched Kobe Bryant play basketball might beg to differ.

title: As Bodega Clinicas Fill Void, Health Officials Are Torn
description: HUNTINGTON PARK, Calif.  The bodega clinicas that line the bustling commercial streets of immigrant neighborhoods around Los Angeles are wedged between money order kiosks and pawnshops. These storefront offices, staffed with Spanish-speaking medical providers, treat ailments for cash: a doctors visit is $20 to $40; a cardiology exam is $120; and at one bustling clinic, a colonoscopy is advertised on an erasable board for $700.

title: Investing Abroad This Year? Remember a Good Map
description: AT the start of 2012, stock investors braced themselves for what seemed to be shaping up as a difficult year abroad.

title: Lazy Jon Stewart
description: Oh, dear. Jon Stewart took on the platinum coin, and made a hash of it  he faceplanted, as Ryan Cooper says.

title: Hypochondria: An Inside Look
description: WHEN The New York Times called, inquiring if I might pen a few words from the horses mouth about hypochondria, I confess I was taken aback. What light could I possibly shed on this type of crackpot behavior since, contrary to popular belief, I am not a hypochondriac but a totally different genus of crackpot?

title: A Record Hang Gliding Ride on the Texas Wind
description: To set a hang gliding distance record, Jonny Durand and Dustin Martin set out last July from Zapata, Tex., and headed north as far as the warm winds would take them.

title: Cant Save? Heres Why
description: THE odds are good that you havent yet given up on your New Years resolutions and that one of them is to swear off those expensive cappuccinos and save money for your old age. Thats a typical suggestion from finance gurus, who say we can add thousands of dollars annually to our nest eggs by eliminating such wasteful spending.

title: Japans Teachable Moment
description: Whatever else you can say about the new turn in Japanese policy, its offering a great demonstration of the peculiarities of zero-lower-bound economics. (JGBs meet the ZLB, OK!)

title: After Foster Care Years, a Woman Becomes a Role Model for Her Sisters
description: Precious Perry shares a few things in common with the fictional protagonist in the 2009 film Precious.

title: Selling Out by Selling Off
description: IT might be time for me to sell out.

title: Writing About What Haunts Us
description: Ive been trying to lie about this story for years. As a fiction writer, I feel an almost righteous obligation to the untruth. Fabrication is my livelihood, and so telling something straight, for me, is the mark of failure. Yet in many attempts over the years Ive not been able to make out of this tiny  but weirdly soul-defining  episode in my life anything more than a plain recounting of the facts, as best as I can remember them. Dressing them up into fiction, in this case, wrecked what is essentially a long overdue confession.

title: Pressing On for the Children
description: As part of the 2012-13 Neediest Cases campaign, The New York Times is catching up with some of the people who were profiled in recent campaigns.

title: Descending Into a State of Nature
description: SURPRISINGLY, Joseph Conrads novella Heart of Darkness has only been filmed once under its own name  as a 1993 made-for-television movie directed by Nicolas Roeg. But with its richly metaphorical plot and tight dramatic structure  leaving the trappings of Western civilization behind, a cultured man embarks on a journey into a strange territory, where he is forced to confront the savagery (the horror, the horror) that survives beneath the surface of polite human behavior  the tale has served as a template for countless works of art (William Faulkners Sanctuary, for example), and perhaps even greater quantities of schlock (Ruggero Deodatos Cannibal Holocaust).

title: Someones Knocking at My Door
description: The editors of Anxiety recently asked the Hungarian novelist Laszlo Krasznahorkai to contribute to the series. Below, in the authors words, is a lyrical essay about the terrible meeting between boorishness and aggressiveness, a meditation on a type of violent person who produces in him the deepest personal anxiety. It was translated by George Szirtes from the Hungarian.

title: Mubarak Is Asked About Media Gifts
description: CAIRO  Prosecutors questioned former President Hosni Mubarak on Saturday about $1 million worth of personal gifts he received from a state news organization over his last six years in office, the organizations Web site reported.

title: N.C. State Announces Its Relevance, Beating No. 1 Duke
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  North Carolina States athletic program has a catchy marketing campaign these days: This is our state. When it comes to mens basketball, that may finally be true.

title: Rivals in Czech Presidential Runoff Support Warmer Ties With Europe
description: PARIS  An outspoken former prime minister and the current foreign minister will face each other in the Czech Republics presidential runoff in two weeks, according to the results of the first round of voting released Saturday.

title: Free-Range Fund Managers, in a Pickle
description: MUTUAL fund managers tend to be held on a short investing leash, but a small subset of funds lets managers run free and place bets on just about any asset class from any part of the world. As liberating as this go-anywhere mandate is, however, managers of some of the largest of these world allocation funds say that no amount of freedom is helping them today  because they arent finding many great opportunities.

title: Two Men, One Sky: A Flight to the Finish
description: T HE CLOUDS stretched across the Texas sky like a highway. And soaring along those lanes, lofted nearly 8,000 feet by the hot air rising from the earth, two hang gliders raced in tight pursuit of the most prized feat in this high adrenaline niche sport: farthest ever flown.

title: Funds That Add Spices to the Stock-and-Bond Mix
description: A PORTFOLIO balanced between stocks and bonds, in a roughly 60-40 split, is a staple diet of investing. These two asset classes often move to different rhythms, so overall returns tend to have milder swings than either one experiences on its own.

title: Strategic Advice, Long Before You Invest
description: TWO market veterans have new books out, offering thoughts about how to invest. But their suggestions come with a twist.

title: Good Economy or Bad, Hurdles for Junk Bonds
description: WHEN the financial crisis erupted several years ago, its victims included lenders to the weakest and most debt-laden companies. Investors in junk-bond mutual funds suffered a negative return of roughly 25 percent in 2008.

title: Versace: Fall 2013 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Versace
description: Donatella Versace offered a delirious and invigorating show in Milan.

title: Their Specialty Was to Find Strong Returns
description: MODERN economies often reward specialists  surgeons who operate only on knees, scholars who study a single author or era, money managers who buy only South Korean or clean-technology stocks. But in the fourth quarter of 2012, old-school generalists led three of the better-performing stock mutual funds.

title: Funds Arent Wielding Much Power Over Executive Pay
description: THE stock market swings up and down, yet executive pay seems to go only higher. Rising executive compensation has been something of a constant in modern capitalism  and so far, at least, managers of mutual funds havent had much of an effect on it.

title: So What Will You Do, Mr. President?
description: If Id spent the past five years living in a monastery or something, I would take the Treasury Departments declaration that the coin option is out as a sign that theres some other plan ready to go. Maybe 14th Amendment, maybe moral obligation coupons or some other form of scrip, something.

title: A Show That Only Versace Could Give
description: MILAN  There were suits in steroidal Al Capone proportions (and accessories: spectator shoes!). There was graffiti print double-denim. There were wide ties lopped so short Emmett Kelly could have worn them. There were studded Stormtrooper boots as well as glossy puffed bombers in the houses trademark neo-Romanesque prints.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Jan. 13
description: As lawmakers take to the Sunday shows to express their opinions on President Obamas cabinet nominations,Colin L. Powell, the retired general and former secretary of state, will join NBCs Meet the Press to voice his support for Chuck Hagel as the next secretary of defense.

title: Follow Two Hang Gliders on Their Record Ride
description: Follow the paths of two hang gliders as they set a new distance record of over 475 miles.

title: Paying the Price, but Often Deducting It
description: THE numbers seem eye-popping. So many billions here for supposed mortgage abuses, so many billions there for questionable foreclosures.

title: Trying to Stop Office Politics in Its Tracks
description: This interview with  Dinesh C. Paliwal, the chairman, president and chief executive of Harman International Industries, the audio and infotainment equipment company, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Im Losing Money. So Why Do I Feel So Good?
description: STEP into a casino and chances are good that slot machines are filling much of the space, as far as the eye can see. That dominant presence reflects the preference of many customers for machine gambling over human-mediated table games. Not surprisingly, electronic game machines contribute a clear majority of casino revenue in the states that permit them.

title: The Auto Loan That Went Haywire
description: SOMETIMES, the Haggler gets the depressing sense that corporations are not reading this column and taking every single word to heart. Crazy, right? The ideas and recommendations offered here are avidly implemented by executives and their underlings across this country. That is a given.

title: Above the Debt Ceiling, Boehner Might Find a Blue Sky
description: ALTHOUGH he has been re-elected as House speaker, John Boehner is in danger of becoming irrelevant to the crucial economics discussions that must occur over the next few months.

title: In Investing, No Need for Sudden Death
description: AMERICA loves a winner, Gen. George S. Patton Jr. told the troops in 1944, and he was surely right. The general also declared, America will not tolerate a loser. He was wrong on that one, but how could he have known about the Mets?

title: To Keep Your Office Resolutions, Start Small
description: Q. Its two weeks into the new year, and you can already see your work-related resolutions start to fall by the wayside. This happens every year, so why do you keep setting these kinds of goals?

title: Costs and Carbon Dioxide
description: To the Editor:

title: New Targets for Future Taxes
description: To the Editor:

title: The Path to Publishing
description: I GREW up in Middletown in southwestern Ohio. My mother took care of my brother and me. My father had several businesses, including a trucking company. I had a paper delivery route and worked as a candy striper at the local hospital.

title: League May Require Teams to Re-Sod Fields
description: DENVER  Commissioner Roger Goodell said Saturday the league will look into whether it should require teams to re-sod parts of their natural grass fields after extensive criticism of the field conditions at FedEx Field in Landover, Md., last weekend. Goodell said there was no complaint after the Redskins regular-season finale against the Cowboys, but one week later, the Seahawks complained at length about the choppy field, which was blamed for the torn knee ligament sustained by Seahawks defensive end Chris Clemons.

title: Magic Square
description: Administrivial Grid Numbering Alert! Due to the unusual nature of Elizabeth C. Gorskis Sunday puzzle, the clue numbering is different in the print and electronic versions.

title: Despite Protests, Gun Show in Upstate New York Goes On
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y.  The line to enter the Saratoga Arms Fair at the City Center here had never been so long, and David Petronis, its organizer, said he had never shaken so many hands in one morning.

title: A Car That Takes the Controls
description: Carnegie Mellon's Autonomous Cadillac SRX can drive itself on public roads, detect and stop for pedestrians, and communicate with traffic signals--among other things--all while looking very normal.

title: After Run of Losses, Knicks Lose Day of Rest
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The Knicks used the word urgency several times after practice Saturday. A three-game losing streak has made them concerned about a lot of things, particularly their defense and their poor starts.

title: Dried Out and Title-Scrubbed, Flooded Cars Lure the Unwary
description: BORDENTOWN, N.J.  At the far end of an enormous hangar, used cars rolled up one by one to the auction block. They had been buffed to a shine, but some carried telltale signs of damage. Puckered leather seats, a hint of mildew, headlights beaded with condensation. Just over two months ago, they had filled with seawater during Hurricane Sandy.

title: A Fiery Preachers Arrival Shakes Pakistani Politics
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Campaign season has begun in Pakistan, with elections widely expected by mid-May that, if they proceed peacefully, would represent a democratic milestone in a country plagued by intermittent military rule.

title: A Soldiers Requiem, Never Fading Away
description: WOODBRIDGE, Va.  Each December, Jackie Finken pulls plastic bins from the basement and distributes carefully wrapped Christmas decorations to her three daughters. Each girl has her own ornaments. And each of those ornaments has a story. That is a Finken tradition, one of many.

title: Six Years Gone
description: Lt. Col. Paul Finken died in Iraq in 2006, leaving behind his wife, Jackie, and their three daughters, Emilie, Caroline and Julia, to figure out which things can heal.

title: Checking on the Status of State Gun Laws
description: As the Obama administration seeks new federal measures to reduce gun violence, states have also moved to enact new laws. Lawmakers in New York have made the biggest push, following Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos State of the State address on Wednesday, in which he proposed changes in several areas.

title: Final: 49ers 45, Packers 31
description: Read on for commentary and live analysis from Saturday nights N.F.C. divisional-round playoff game between the Green Bay Packers and the San Francisco 49ers as it happened. The game was a rematch of the teams Week 1 encounter, won by the 49ers, 30-22, but that game offered few clues about what was to come Saturday night.

title: At Arraignment, Account of a Threat Before a Fatal Fire
description: The suspect in the deadly fire that engulfed a Manhattan apartment building on Thursday night told someone: You die, I die, everybody dies, just before igniting two beds in his apartment, a prosecutor said at his arraignment on Saturday.

title: Pointed in Right Direction, Nets Arent Interested in Looking Back
description: Brook Lopez had his feet planted in an ice bath, and Deron Williamss right thigh was wrapped thickly with gauze. Gerald Wallace had X-rays taken of his ribs. There was fear that a flu bug was going around.

title: Treasury Wont Mint Coin to Defy Debt Ceiling
description: WASHINGTON  The Treasury Department said Saturday that it will not mint a trillion-dollar platinum coin to head off an imminent battle with Congress over raising the governments borrowing limit.

title: On Scale of 0 to 500, Beijings Air Quality Tops Crazy Bad at 755
description: BEIJING  One Friday more than two years ago, an air-quality monitoring device atop the United States Embassy in Beijing recorded data so horrifying that someone in the embassy called the level of pollution Crazy Bad in an infamous Twitter post. That day the Air Quality Index, which uses standards set by the United States Environmental Protection Agency, had crept above 500, which was supposed to be the top of the scale.

title: Taking Violence Against Women Seriously.
description: My Sunday column grew out of the rape/murder in Delhi. At the time I was in China, reporting there, and so I didnt weigh in. But this is of course an issue that Ive covered in one way or another for decades and that Sheryl and I tried to call attention to in Half the Sky, and friends began emailing me about other incidents of sexual violence or gender violence that deserved attention. An American woman raped in India, whom the authorities werent interested in. A 13-year-old girl dying of injuries caused by rape in Liberia. A separate incident in which an 8-year-old girl is kidnapped by a pimp in Liberia. A woman in San Francisco allegedly doused with gasoline by her boyfriend and set on fire. A girl in Nepal burned alive because she refused a marriage offer. And so on and so on.

title: Hawks on Iraq Prepare for War Again, Against Hagel
description: In the bitter debate that led up to the American invasion of Iraq in 2003, Senator Chuck Hagel of Nebraska said that some of his fellow Republicans, in their zest for war, lacked the perspective of veterans like him, who have sat in jungles or foxholes and watched their friends get their heads blown off.

title: Winter Jazzfest: A New-World Meshing of Pop and Folk
description: Day 2 of Winter Jazzfest began, for me, with Claudia Acua at the Bitter End, reharmonizing You Are My Sunshine for a standing-room crowd. I feel as if Im still digesting last nights offerings, including a brilliantly indeterminate set by the bassist Eric Revis, the pianist Kris Davis and the drummer Andrew Cyrille; and a midnight set by Nasheet Waitss Equality, featuring the pianist Vijay Iyer. I tumbled into bed this morning at 3:30, and spent most of the day looking forward to more of the same.

title: Despite Taliban Threat, Afghanistan Manages to Entice Some Tourists
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Taliban have a message for foreign tourists who come to Afghanistan, especially if they are from any of the 50 countries that are part of the NATO-led coalition supporting the government: Big mistake.

title: Obama Will Seek Citizenship Path in One Fast Push
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama plans to push Congress to move quickly in the coming months on an ambitious overhaul of the immigration system that would include a path to citizenship for most of the 11 million illegal immigrants in the country, senior administration officials and lawmakers said last week.

title: Accommodating an Old Honky-Tonk in New Austin
description: Old Austin clashes with New Austin nearly every day, causing much worry among the citys natives: Will these new condos and luxury hotels rub out everything that makes their weird city great? Will the shows for hipster musicians dry up? Is $10 guacamole really worth it?

title: Energy Industry Awaits U.S. Ruling on Prairie Chicken
description: In a few months, a grouse known as the lesser prairie chicken will emerge from its West Texas winter hideaway. Males will do a loud and elaborate mating dance, delighting females  and bird-watchers.

title: Indias New Focus on Rape Shows Only the Surface of Womens Perils
description: NEW DELHI  Harassed for years by her husband and his relatives, an Indian woman was finally kidnapped, raped, strangled and tossed into a ditch.

title: In Double Overtime Drama, Ravens Stun Broncos
description: DENVER  In Peyton Mannings 15-year career, there has been a lone dent in his legacy. For all of his regular-season brilliance, Manning has, in all but one season, been unable to propel his team to the championship. Mannings teams have gone to the postseason 12 times, but in 7 of the previous 11 trips, Mannings team has lost in its first playoff game.

title: Winter Jazzfest: Saxophone Whiz, Inspired by a Whale
description: The saxophonist Colin Stetson, who performed a scarily proficient solo set at the Bitter End tonight, is a one-man astonishment engine. This isnt news to anyone who has seen him live  a substantial number of people, given his indie-rock cachet  but this was my first time hearing him in person, and I wont forget it soon.

title: Some State Legislators Blur Line Between Public and Private Interests
description: On the presidential campaign trail, Gov. Rick Perry waxed eloquent about the merits of Texas part-time Legislature, saying that Congress would be more effective if its members had real jobs back at home.

title: In Wyoming, Many Jobs but No Place to Call Home
description: CASPER, Wyo.  After losing everything last year to Southern Californias soured economy, Tiffany Kipp and her family packed up three boxes and a diaper bag and caught a Greyhound bus to Wyoming, their best chance at a fresh start.

title: Wyomings Boom Economy Offers Jobs, but Little Chance for Housing
description: There is a surprising downside to Wyomings economic resilience and its 5.1 percent unemployment rate: a sharp rise in homelessness.

title: Shortest Bronco Sets Two N.F.L. Records
description: DENVER  At 5 feet 5 inches, Trindon Holliday of the Denver Broncos is the N.F.L.s shortest player and its biggest good-luck charm.

title: A Quandary for the Game in a High-Tech Era
description: A third-place finish at a tournament last month by a formerly obscure player was so startling that organizers searched his clothing and took apart his pen looking for evidence that he had outside help. They found nothing.

title: Israelis Evict Palestinians From a Site for Housing
description: JERUSALEM  Israeli security forces evicted scores of Palestinian activists before dawn on Sunday from a tent encampment they had set up set up two days earlier in a strategic piece of Israeli-occupied West Bank territory known as E1, east of Jerusalem, where Israel says it plans to build settler homes.

title: Corrections: January 13, 2013
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Winter Jazzfest: A Happy Audience, for Whatever the Genre
description: There isnt a handy term of genre for the music that Kneebody creates. Its a band thoroughly acquainted with 1960s free-bop, 1970s jazz rock, 1990s hip-hop and postmillennial indie rock; along with classical postminimalism. (Im leaving something out, Im sure.) Whatever the terminology, this group has an audience: its set at Culture Project theater is packed beyond capacity, and the crowd has been vocal in its enthusiasm.

title: Kaepernick Passes and Runs and Dominates in 49ers Victory
description: SAN FRANCISCO  There were 22 players on the field, dozens more on the sideline, 69,732 fans at Candlestick Park and millions watching from home.

title: Bess Greenbaum, Andrew Seewald
description: Bess Gail Greenbaum and Andrew Eric Seewald were married Saturday evening at Guastavinos, an event space in Manhattan. Rabbi David Ingber officiated.

title: Katherine Bedingfield and David Kieve
description: Katherine Joan Bedingfield and David Kelley Kieve were married Saturday evening at St. Johns Episcopal Church Lafayette Square in Washington. The Rev. Dr. Luis Len, the churchs rector, performed the ceremony.

title: Matthew Birkhold and Jordan Elkind
description: Matthew Hoover Birkhold, a son of Lee Stephenson Birkhold and Richard A. Birkhold of Stillwater, Minn., was married Saturday to Jordan Michael Elkind, the son of Kerry J. Weiner and Andrew E. Elkind of San Francisco. Rabbi Lev Baesh officiated at St. Pauls Chapel of Columbia University in Manhattan, with assistance from the Rev. Richard A. Nelson, a Lutheran minister.

title: Cameron Bierce and Jonathan Hume
description: Cameron Higgins Bierce and Jonathan Matthew Hume were married Saturday evening at the Yale Club in Manhattan. The Rev. Dr. Edwin Cromey, an Episcopal priest, officiated.

title: Janhavi Kirtane and Oliver Fritz III
description: Janhavi Mohan Kirtane and Oliver Harvey Fritz III were married Saturday at Houston Station, an event space in Nashville. Pandit Koteswaran K. Gurukkal, a Hindu priest, officiated.

title: Amy Eisen, Harrie Bakst
description: Amy Eisen and Harrie H. Bakst were married Saturday evening by Rabbi Steven A. Exler at the Central Park Boathouse in Manhattan.

title: Reyzl Geselowitz, Michael Pershan
description: Reyzl Reba Geselowitz, a daughter of Emily M. Schneider and Michael N. Geselowitz of Cedarhurst, N.Y., is to be married Sunday to Michael Brandon Pershan, a son of Debbie A. Pershan and Marc H. Pershan of Skokie, Ill. Rabbi Ben Greenberg is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Kneseth Israel in Far Rockaway, Queens.

title: Claire Freedman and David Kusnetz
description: Claire Olla Freedman, the daughter of Debra O. Freedman and Robert J. Freedman of Scarsdale, N.Y., was married Saturday evening to David Matthew Kusnetz, a son of Marcia E. Kusnetz and Dan A. Kusnetz, both of White Plains. Rabbi Leslie Y. Gutterman officiated at the Lighthouse at Chelsea Piers in New York.

title: Elizabeth Gonzalez and Bradford Sussman
description: Elizabeth Ruth Gonzalez and Bradford Jay Sussman are to be married Sunday by Rabbi Ari Fridkis at the Angel Orensanz Foundation for Contemporary Art in Manhattan.

title: Michaella Dooley, Douglas Kurdziel
description: Michaella Gabrielle Dooley and Douglas Hall Kurdziel were married Saturday at St. Josephs Church Yorkville in New York. The Rev. Boniface Ramsey, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Cautious Calls, and a Calamitous Finish
description: DENVER  The Denver Broncos had this one. With a 7-point lead late in the game, possession of the ball and Peyton Manning running the offense, Broncos fans had every reason to believe their team would still be playing next weekend.

title: Whats On Sunday
description: 8 P.M. (NBC) THE 70TH ANNUAL GOLDEN GLOBE AWARDS Tina Fey and Amy Poehler (above, from left) host these awards  considered predictors of the Oscars  sponsored by the Hollywood Foreign Press Association and broadcast live from the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Los Angeles. In the motion picture drama division, nominees include Argo, Django Unchained, Life of Pi, Lincoln and Zero Dark Thirty for best picture; Jessica Chastain, Marion Cotillard, Helen Mirren, Naomi Watts and Rachel Weisz for best actress; and Daniel Day-Lewis, Richard Gere, John Hawkes, Joaquin Phoenix and Denzel Washington for best actor. In the comedy or musical division, the nominees are The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel, Les Misrables, Moonrise Kingdom, Salmon Fishing in the Yemen and Silver Linings Playbook for best picture; Emily Blunt, Judi Dench, Jennifer Lawrence, Maggie Smith and Meryl Streep for best actress; and Jack Black, Bradley Cooper, Hugh Jackman, Ewan McGregor and Bill Murray for best actor. Jodie Foster will receive the Cecil B. DeMille Award. Awards will also be handed out for television work. Coverage from the red carpet begins at 6 on E! and at 7 on NBC; E! will visit after-parties at 11.

title: Eugene C. Patterson, Editor and Civil Rights Crusader, Dies at 89
description: Eugene C. Patterson, the Pulitzer Prize-winning editor of The Atlanta Constitution during the civil rights conflicts of the 1960s and later the managing editor of The Washington Post and editor of The St. Petersburg Times in Florida, died on Saturday in St. Petersburg. He was 89.

title: Breathing in Beijing: Coping With Chinas Smog
description: BEIJING  With Beijings air pollution soaring to seemingly new, awful records this weekend, the classic parenting dilemma of What shall we do with the kids? had a grimly obvious answer: Slap on the antipollution face masks and go shopping for another air purifier.

title: Big Payoff in Harbaughs Gamble With Kaepernick
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Jim Harbaugh has spent his entire coaching career as nothing short of a football alchemist, a mad genius in a mock turtleneck and a scowl. Most recently he has been responsible for turning the chronically dysfunctional San Francisco 49ers into one of leagues best teams  a ranking that improved with a 45-31 victory over the Green Bay Packers on Saturday in an N.F.C. divisional playoff game.

title: Chinese Media Censorship
description: The censor at the wheel.

title: Bottega Veneta: Fall 2013 Menswear
description: Milan

title: Bottega Veneta
description: Tomas Maiers fall 2013 collection was all about the details.

title: Russians Rally Against Adoption Ban in a Revival of Anti-Kremlin Protests
description: MOSCOW  Thousands of Russians marched Sunday to condemn the Parliaments move to ban the adoption of Russian children by American families, an event called a March Against Scoundrels. The protesters chanted, Take your hands off children, and carried posters showing the faces of lawmakers stamped with the word shame.

title: Egyptian Court Rejects Verdict Against Mubarak
description: CAIRO  An Egyptian appeals court on Sunday threw out the guilty verdict and life sentence against former President Hosni Mubarak on charges that he allowed the killing of protesters. The court ordered a new trial, which would once again send the ailing autocrat rolling on a stretcher into the steel defendants cage in an Egyptian criminal court.

title: By George
description: Or, actually, *with* George. Yes, Im Stephanopoulizing again. Off in a few minutes to do some web stuff for ABC, followed by This Week.

title: A Second-by-Second Look at the Flacco Fling
Now Streaming | Calvin Klein Fall 2013 Mens Collection
description: The Fall 2013 mens collection from Calvin Klein at Milan Fashion Week, scheduled to commence at 2 p.m. Milan time. Delays may occur.

title: Ferragamo: Fall 2013 Menswear
description: Milan

description: Milan

title: Indian Woman Is Gang-Raped After Bus Ride
description: NEW DELHI  A 29-year-old woman was raped over the weekend by a bus driver, a conductor and five other men in the northern Indian state of Punjab, the police said Sunday, in an episode that recalls the recent attack in Delhi that has caused widespread outrage.

title: Afghans Killed After Allies Target Taliban
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An explosion in a mountain village in eastern Afghanistan on Sunday killed at least seven civilians after a joint American-Afghan military raid killed four Taliban fighters there, Afghan officials said. But villagers said 16 civilians had been killed.

title: A Son Risks His Life on the Highway
description: My 21-year-old son, Sam, pulled a guy out of a burning car on Interstate 95 in Connecticut a week ago, and despite my having four children, Ive never said that before. Im hoping its a once-in-a-lifetime kind of thing.

title: Nissan Gives Leaf Owners a Preview of the 2013 Model
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Nissan will not formally announce the 2013 version of the all-electric Leaf until early this week at the Detroit auto show, but on Saturday the company offered a sneak preview to the Bay Area Nissan Leaf Owners Association.

title: China Again Is Growing, More Slowly
description: GUANGZHOU, China  After a sharp economic slowdown through much of last year, Chinas economy is growing again  but not at its previous double-digit pace, and with signs that inflation might become a problem again.

title: Photos of The Moment | Jil Sander
