Microsoft, which has not yet made a commitment, has more than $66 billion in cash on hand. The company has done business with Silver Lake in the past, including when Microsoft acquired Skype in 2011.

title: Taiwans Diverse Literature and History on Show in Two New Museums
description: TAINAN  Two new museums in Tainan, a city in Taiwans south, say much about how the islands people have worked in recent years to build an unusually inclusive cultural identity, a model for Chinese-speaking societies, as I write in my Letter from Taiwan this week.

title: RIM Still Unable to Clarify Its Fee Structure
description: For their maker, Research in Motion, BlackBerrys have always been the gift that keeps on giving. Until now, every BlackBerry handset has continued to generate monthly service fees for the company until it falls apart or is stuck in a drawer.

title: Overheard at Le Bernardin
description: Dear Diary:

title: Wednesday Reading: A Trio of Thrifty Lures in New Orleans
Despite Boycott, More Than Half of Voters Are Said to Turn Out in Jordan Election
description: MULEIH, Jordan  Two years ago, Mohamed al-Snaid organized laborers to demonstrate against poor working conditions, helping to start a movement that spread throughout the country and gave voice to a festering anger that has shaken the rule of King Abdullah II.

title: The Courtesy Control Malfunctions
description: You might not know this unless we have met, but I am an exceptionally polite person.

title: When Paying It Forward Pays Us Back
description: If youve listened to the debate on how the United States should avoid going over the fiscal cliff over the past months, you might believe that the government has only two options to address its budget woes  either slash social programs, as conservatives favor, or the liberal tack, raise taxes. Thats a myopic view, one that actually distorts the relationship between social programs and society at large. Many of the most effective ones are not a mere expense to be trimmed off a budget; they often can and do save considerable money for society. And theyd be even more economical in this regard if the government invested in their widespread adoption.

title: Mayer, Hudson and Aguilera Among Performers for Rock Hall Ceremony
description: John Mayer, Jennifer Hudson and Christina Aguilera are among the musicians who will perform at the induction ceremony in April for the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum.

title: Photos of The Moment | Giorgio Armani Priv
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Updates on Clintons Testimony on the Benghazi Attack
description: The Lede followed Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clintons testimony Wednesday before the House Foreign Affairs Committee and Senate Foreign Relations Committee about the Sept. 11, 2012, attacks on the American Consulate in the eastern city of Benghazi, Libya, that killed Ambassador Chris Stevens and three other Americans.

title: Start-Up Uses Portal Game as Recruiting Tool
description: If you want to signal to software engineers that your tech start-up is a cool place to work, you can let them bring their dogs to the office, offer free energy drinks or put up a billboard with a Web address that can only be accessed after solving a math equation.

title: Boeings Battery Problems Cast Doubt on Appraisal of New Technologies
description: In December 2006, the Federal Aviation Administration allowed Airbus, the European plane maker, to use 14-ounce lithium-ion batteries to provide standby power for the emergency lighting system of its new A380 jumbo jet.

title: Facing Congress, Clinton Defends Her Actions Before and After Libya Attack
description: WASHINGTON  In one of her final appearances as secretary of state, Hillary Rodham Clinton on Wednesday vigorously defended her handling of last Septembers attack on the United States diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, which killed four Americans and prompted a scathing review of State Department procedures.

title: Carnegie Halls Spring for Music Will Expire on Fitting Notes
description: The final performance of the final season of Spring for Music, an orchestra festival at Carnegie Hall, will have a fittingly morbid theme, according to programming announced on Tuesday. The Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra, on May 10, 2014, will present the last scene of Poulencs opera Dialogues of the Carmelites, in which a group of nuns are serially guillotined; the first New York performance of James MacMillans Woman of the Apocalypse, based on the Book of Revelation; and a mlange of Mozart music  titled Requiem and Death in Words and Music  centered around his completed sections of the Requiem. Pittsburghs music director, Manfred Honeck, will conduct.

title: In Saint-milion, Rich and Proud of It
description: SAINT-MILION, FranceThere is a saying in France: Vivre cache, vivre heureux; live hidden, live happily. It applies especially to the countrys rich people. Not only do public displays of wealth draw the covetous gaze of tax collectors, they are frowned on by a culture that values solidarity.

title: A Break in the Case of the Kunsthal Heist
description: Three people have been arrested in connection with the theft of seven paintings from a museum in the Netherlands, the police in Rotterdam announced Tuesday.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: How ESPN Missed the Hoax Story and Hard Times at Sundance
description: ESPN had been trying to confirm the story that Manti Teos girlfriend  whose apparent death from leukemia became a rallying cry for Notre Dame football and a selling-point for the linebackers Heisman candidacy  was a hoax. But the network was hoping for an interview with Mr. Teo and lost the story to Deadspin.

title: Britons Promised Vote on Europe, Again
description: LONDON  A British political leader faces dissent within his own party over the countrys membership in Europe. He promises to renegotiate the terms and to hold a referendum on the issue if he wins the next election.

title: Clintons Full Statement on Benghazi Attack
description: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clintons testimony before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee on Wednesday on the September attack in Benghazi.

title: From Jolie-ing at the Oscars to a Sundance Ovation
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Nat Faxon and Jim Rash arrived at Sundance with their first feature, The Way, Way Back, in an enviable position: theyre already Oscar winners. Mr. Faxon and Mr. Rash took the prize last year, along with Alexander Payne, for adapting the screenplay for The Descendants. They also created one of the more memorable memes of the show. But more on that later.

title: I.M.F. Forecasts Modest Global Economic Growth
description: WASHINGTON  The International Monetary Fund said on Wednesday that it continued to expect a modest upturn in global growth in 2013, with fewer risks of major policy mistakes and lower levels of financial stress.

title: Russian Minister Backs Assad, and Adoption Ban
description: MOSCOW  Russias foreign minister, Sergey V. Lavrov, said on Wednesday that the main obstacle to peace in Syria was the oppositions obsession with the idea of toppling the Bashar al-Assad regime. He also said that the Kremlins Emergency Ministry flights that removed 77 Russians from the war zone early on Wednesday had not signaled the start of an evacuation.

title: Possible Second Suspect Sought in Houston Shooting
description: HOUSTON  Law enforcement officials said Wednesday that they had not recovered the pistol used in a shooting at a community college on Tuesday that left four people hospitalized, but that they had charged the student they say fired the shots and were still searching for a possible second suspect.

title: Fitting In/Standing Out
description: In high school, theres a hazy line between the right kind of standing out and the wrong kind, between fitting into the crowd and being just another follower. Veer too far to one extreme and you risk ostracism; too far to the other, and you risk ordinariness.

title: Movie Attention for Chastain Gives Heiress a Broadway Bounce
description: The actress Jessica Chastain, fresh off an Oscar nomination and Golden Globe win for Zero Dark Thirty, wasnt just generating ticket sales at the movies last week. Her Broadway play, The Heiress, had its best week since mid-November, according to box office data released on Tuesday by the Broadway League, the trade association of theater owners and producers.

title: If You Like Cat Stevens, Try Junip
description: Each week, Val Haller, the founder of the music Web site Valslist.com, matches music from her baby boom generation to that of her 20-something sons generation.

title: Report on Indias Sexual Assault Laws Mixes Scathing Criticism With Proposed Changes
description: A special committee formed to recommend changes to Indias sexual assault laws after the fatal gang rape of a 23-year-old woman in New Delhi proposed far-reaching police and judicial reforms Wednesday, new liability for armed official personnel accused of committing sexual offenses and recognition of sex crimes against homosexuals.

title: Share of the Work Force in a Union Falls to a 97-Year Low, 11.3%
description: The long decline in the number of American workers belonging to labor unions accelerated sharply last year, according to data reported on Wednesday, sending the unionization rate to its lowest level in close to a century.

title: New Yorkers Shiver as Frigid Air Hits the City
description: It may seem like cold comfort, but New York City has it lucky  at least compared with our upstate neighbors.

description: Home values rose nearly 6 percent in 2012, according to year-end data from the real estate Web site Zillow. But such increases arent likely to continue.

title: New Path for Trade: Selling in China
description: Like many American businesses fighting to keep their prices competitive, Vision Quest Lighting turned to China about six years ago. It now imports about a sixth of the two dozen to three dozen parts required to make its lighting fixtures from there. Recently, however, the Long Island company began to see China in a different light: as a sales target. The growing economy of the worlds most populous nation made it ripe for Vision Quests architectural lighting fixtures, many custom-made for hotel and restaurant chains like Hilton and KFC.

title: Theyre Twins, Ex-Models and (Very) Enthusiastic Directors
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Lets just be honest: a lot of Sundance vim and vigor comes courtesy of the booze that flows through this resort town. The youthfulness of attendees similarly plays a role. Is there anyone left in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, at the moment?

title: Martin Wolf, Hippie

His case is pretty much the same one Ive been making; also, unlike Larry Summers yesterday, his piece doesnt blur its point by starting with an extended exercise in dutiful deficit-bashing.

title: Have You Tried Selling in China?
description: A small-business guide we have just published quotes Savio S. Chan, who is president and chief executive of U.S. China Partners, a consulting firm that over the last eight years has helped nearly 100 American companies do business in China. Initially, the firm connected these companies with manufacturers and suppliers in China; of late, it has helped more clients market and sell their products and services in China. Both the Golden State Warriors and the New Jersey Nets of the N.B.A. called upon Mr. Chan to seek corporate partners in China to capitalize on the Chinese heritage of roster players.

description: Today, members of the House Armed Services Committee are scheduled to meet in full session for a hearing on sexual assault in the military. That they are doing so is in large part a tribute to one of the five movies nominated this month for the Academy Award for best feature-length documentary, Kirby Dicks Invisible War.

Among the team members suggestions: Subprime Meltdown, Hitman, Nuclear Holocaust and Mike Tysons Punchout, as well a simple yet direct reference to a bag of excrement.

title: Where Dead Animals Seem Alive
description: The American Museum of Natural History has been a source of inspiration since I moved to New York more than eight years ago. One of my first trips there was with my drawing class during my freshman year at the School of Visual Arts. We were assigned to make a series of drawings based on a shape that inspired us at the museum. I chose a shape that I saw on a 3-D cross-section of a space rock.

description: On a slow day over the holidays, I added up how many frequent flier miles I had in various accounts  more than 250,000  and realized I should start cashing in those miles for free trips.

title: Royal Shakespeare Company to Stage Wolf Hall and Bring Up the Bodies
description: Wolf Hall and Bring Up the Bodies, Hilary Mantels pair of Man Booker Prize-winning novels about Tudor England, are coming to the stage. The Royal Shakespeare Company announced on Wednesday that Mike Poulton, known for his theatrical versions of classic works like The Canterbury Tales and Le Morte dArthur, is adapting both books for the company, and that the stage versions, directed by Jeremy Herrin, will appear in repertory starting in December.

title: Wayne LaPierre Strikes Again
description: President Obama made only glancing reference to gun control in his Inaugural Address, merely saying that we need to keep our children safe from the streets of Detroit to the hills of Appalachia to the quiet lanes of Newtown. But he didnt fool Wayne LaPierre, the ever-vigilant executive vice president of the National Rifle Association.

title: Below the Line: Dressing Snow White
description: Colleen Atwood is no stranger to the Oscars. The much sought-after costume designer has been nominated for 10 Academy Awards and has won three for her work on Chicago (2002), Memoirs of a Geisha (2006) and Alice in Wonderland (2010).

title: Before Setting Off, a Drill
description: The cruise industry has instituted 10 new safety policies in response to the Costa Concordia crash that killed 32 people a year ago. The Cruise Lines International Association, the trade group that represents major cruise lines globally, has developed requirements over the last year that muster drills, passenger emergency drills, be conducted before departing from port rather than within 24 hours of sailing, and that the crew receives more mandatory lifeboat training, among other measures. The International Maritime Organization, a United Nations agency that oversees maritime safety, said it expects to make muster drills before departure mandatory.

title: Protecting Teenagers From High Schools Big Box
description: If high school is, as Jennifer Senior writes in Why You Truly Never Leave High School for New York magazine, corrosive and traumatizing, then it begs a question: how (barring home schooling) can we steel our teenage children against the institutions effect on their sense of themselves?

title: Leading Off: Playing the Makeup Game
description: Whats the use of breaking up, Jerry (the Iceman) Butler once sang, when you just turn around and make up?

title: Clinton Testifies About Benghazi
description: The Times's Mark Landler discusses Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton's testimony before Congress about last year's attack on the American mission in Libya.

title: More Than 20 Million Viewers Watched Coverage of Inauguration
description: A total of 20.552 million viewers tuned in on 18 separate television networks to watch coverage of the second inauguration of President Obama, the Nielsen Company reported Wednesday.

title: Suspects in Dutch Art Heist (if Not the Art Itself) in Custody
description: Three suspects in the theft of seven masterpieces from the Kunsthal Museum in Rotterdam, the Netherlands, have been arrested in Romania, but there is still no word on where the stolen art might be, the BBC reported. The paintings, which include works by Monet, Picasso, Matisse and Lucien Freud, were taken from the gallery on Oct. 16. A spokeswoman for the Rotterdam police, Yvette van den Heerik, said that the suspects involvement was still being investigated.

title: Killer Penguins, Asteroids and Maple Leaves
description: Wednesday in Science, were reading about killer penguins, texting moms, asteroid mining, designing a more pleasurable condom and a maple leaf controversy in Canada. Check out these and other science headlines from around the Web.

description: The objectivity argument I wrote about this month continues to simmer. In the interests of making this blog a continuing conversation about journalism issues, large and small, Im posting a few of the most substantial pieces on this subject that Ive seen in recent weeks.

title: Site to Be Seen | constrvct.com
description: To established fashion designers, Mary Huang and Jenna Fizel may well appear as the Visigoths did to the Romans: outsiders bent on cheerfully upending civilization as they know it. Interaction designers by training and novices to the fashion world, the two have started a clothing label that essentially eliminates the need for the creative vision of one person. Instead, theyve created software that puts that power in the hands of consumers, a process Huang calls fashion design for the Instagram generation. Shoppers logging on to constrvct.com can upload a photograph that will later be translated into a print, choose from a variety of basic silhouettes (the sheath dress is currently the most popular), then plug in their measurements. Three weeks later, a dress arrives in the mail, a time scale Huang estimate will be cut by two-thirds once the partners raise the funds to bring production in-house. Soon, pre-existing images will be available for selection, with royalties going to the artists who created them. And plans are afoot to add further customizing options like neckline, sleeve and hemline choices. We dont even need to make a pattern, Huang says. We can make the dress directly from the 3-D model. Its basically you press the button, we make the dress. If we can do this at scale, it could change the way the whole industry works.

title: Hats Off to President Obama
description: David Brooks: Lets get to the big news of the week first, at least to me. Did you know that Jimmy Carter once allegedly went after a dog with a saw because it ate some of his cats food? This is an old story, I guess, told by a disgruntled former Secret Service agent, but Id never heard it until it had a viral resurgence this week.

title: House Vote Sidesteps an Ultimatum on Debt
description: WASHINGTON  Avoiding an economic showdown with President Obama, the House on Wednesday passed legislation to eliminate the nations statutory borrowing limit until May, without including the dollar-for-dollar spending cuts that Republicans once insisted would have to be part of any debt limit bill.

description: Its only the first full day of the World Economic Forum festivities in Davos, Switzerland, and already the gloves are coming off.

title: Federer Prevails Over Tsonga to Set Up Match With Murray
description: MELBOURNE  They have been playing two different tournaments: Andy Murray in the sunshine and Roger Federer under the lights. But the schedules will be harmonized at last on Friday night when they meet in the semifinals of the Australian Open.

title: Ryan Expects Debt Deal but Takes Taxes Off the Table
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan predicted on Wednesday that the two parties would produce a big down payment on reducing federal debt this year, yet outlined Republican conditions  chiefly no new tax revenues  that would seem to rule out any budget agreement with President Obama and the Democratic-controlled Senate.

title: Players Discuss Anchored Putting at Meeting
description: SAN DIEGO  Tim Clark, who is not entered in this weeks Farmers Insurance Open, at Torrey Pines, traveled here from his home in Scottsdale, Ariz., to attend the annual players meeting Tuesday night. It was Clarks first opportunity to ask Mike Davis, the executive director of the United States Golf Association, questions about the ban on anchored putting, which was proposed in November by the U.S.G.A. and the Royal & Ancient.

title: Can You Read the Face of Victory?
description: Picture a tennis player in the moment he scores a critical point and wins a tournament. Now picture his opponent in the instant he loses the point that narrowly cost him the title. Can you tell one facial expression from the other, the look of defeat from the face of victory?

title: Bombing at a Funeral in Northern Iraq Kills at Least 35
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq  A crowded tent full of Turkmen mourners in northern Iraq was transformed into a mass killing ground on Wednesday by a suicide bombing that left at least 35 people dead and 117 wounded, regional officials and tribal leaders said, calling it a genocidal attack meant to further stoke the already-inflamed sectarian tensions in the country.

He said she would have to accept full responsibility, and went so far as to compare Mrs. Clintons alleged failings with those of government itself: Thats the problem with government  government is anonymous and so no one is accountable.

title: Up Ahead: The World According to Gore
description: The Future: Six Drivers of Global Change, the title of Al Gores ambitious, drily written new book, sounds like a snoozy think-tank talk. And while its about 30 times as long, thats exactly what this volume is, a wonky overview of the forces that are remaking the world: economic globalization, the digital revolution, climate change, dwindling natural resources, shifts in the global balance of power and advances in the life sciences.

And it has happened to Jeff Harnar, the ingenuous cabaret crooner who in the 1980s and 90s might have played the same chirpy eager-beaver roles associated with Mr. Morse had they been created.

description: Zagg has simultaneously entered two markets with one device, the Origin.

title: A Resurgent Netflix Beats Projections, Even Its Own
description: 1:51 p.m. | Updated For all those who have doubted its business acumen, Netflix had a resounding answer on Wednesday: 27.15 million.

title: A Singers Life and Her Songs, Separated by the Thinnest Line
description: Iris DeMent released Sing the Delta (Flariella) late last year, eight years after her previous release  Lifeline, a collection of religious songs  and 16 years after her last album of original material.

title: Fox Shelves Ben and Kate on Tuesdays
description: The dismal year for new television comedies continued Wednesday with Fox pulling Ben and Kate  one of the few modestly praised new comedies of the year  from its schedule

title: Heady Returns, but Apple Finds Its Stock Falling
description: Apple on Wednesday reported the kind of quarter most big companies would envy, posting a profit of $13.1 billion and selling 28 percent more iPhones and 48 percent more iPads, its two biggest products.

title: K.K.R. Takes 25% Stake in Firm That Invests in Natural Disasters
description: In its latest move to bolster its asset management arm, Kohlberg Kravis Roberts has found an unusual partner: a hedge fund seeking to invest in natural disasters.

title: Roller Derby Exerts Its Pull on Everyman
description: Slap on some wheels and chase your dream, or stay stock still and remain true to the girl you love? Thats the hard choice faced by Jack Lovington (Patch Darragh), the would-be skating star and Everyman hero of The Jammer, the slightly tattered comic book of a play by Rolin Jones presented by the Atlantic Theater Company at the troupes smaller stage on 16th Street in Chelsea.

title: Urging Action, Report on Brutal Rape Condemns Indias Treatment of Women
description: NEW DELHI  Women in India face systemic discrimination and are regularly confronted with sexual harassment and violence, even as the police often fail to provide protection and the government has failed to enforce laws and policies intended to safeguard womens rights, according to a scathing special report released on Wednesday.

title: Pictures of the Day: Mali and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Mali, Israel, India and more.

title: ASAP Rocky, From Mixtape Darling to Top of the Chart
description: The Harlem rapper ASAP Rocky became a mixtape darling two years ago, and now, with his proper debut released on a major label, he has a No. 1 album as well.

title: Small Gestures, Big Statements
description: PARIS  Whats so likable about the Paris mens shows is that theyre modest affairs. Half the time youre squashed with your comrades in a chilly room that resembles a garage, looking at some guys in tailcoats seemingly fashioned from Moms chenille robe. Even the allusions to the awkward shift into manhood  here from the great Rei Kawakubo of Comme des Garons  are modestly dispensed.

title: A Country House on the Isle of Guernsey
description: A three-story Victorian with a pool and English Channel views is on the market for $3.1 million.

title: House Hunting in ... the Channel Islands
description: A VICTORIAN COUNTRY HOME ON THE ISLE OF GUERNSEY

title: A New Kind of Holster for the iPhone
description: Unless you carry a Bushmaster Adaptive Combat Rifle around, the Sector 5 Black Ops iPhone cover from Element Case is likely to be the most polarizing accessory you own.

title: Precision Abounds During Couture Fashion Week
description: Young designers are learning to use the extraordinary skills of a couture atelier to be more self-critical and demanding, something Karl Lagerfeld has been doing for years.

title: And Precisely So
description: PARIS  Outwardly, the spring haute couture shows were about the joys of gardening and how many brides you could put on a runway. (Dior, 5; Chanel, 2, though Karl Lagerfeld might have upstaged Raf Simons of Dior by having a pair of lesbian brides.) Not to be left out, the house of Valentino also dug a garden theme.

title: Sounds of Sundance
description: During the Sundance Film Festival, you can see movies and also hear performances from established stars like Nas, Dave Grohl and Andrew Bird or promotional concerts for music documentaries.

title: Homes for $1.1 Million
description: Properties in Pennsylvania, Phoenix and Tennessee.

title: What You Get for ... $1.1 Million
description: LUMBERVILLE, PA.

title: From Midwest to East, Subzero Temperatures Turn Mild Winter Deadly
description: ST. PAUL, Minn.  A bracing wave of Arctic air swept across much of the nation on Wednesday, suddenly turning what had been a relatively mild winter into a shivering misery that has caused several deaths in the Midwest and prompted cities along the Eastern Seaboard to open emergency shelters.

title: Rolling Stone Lays Off Two Noted Staff Members
description: 6:02 p.m. | Updated Rolling Stone, amid a variety of magazines responding to a troubled advertising environment by trimming staff, laid off two of its bigger names this month.

title: AT&Ts TV, Phone and Internet Service Is Down in Some States
description: 6:33 p.m. | Updated Adding comment from AT&T in response to whether customers will get refunds.

title: Chef Who Refuses to Be Defined by His Wok
description: The firebrand chef Eddie Huang tookover a table at Hot Kitchen, a Sichuan restaurant in the East Village, and commandeered the remote control. It was a Saturday night, and the Orlando Magic was losing to the New York Knicks. As Carmelo Anthony worked his way to 40 points, Mr. Huangs body jerked in sympathetic rebound.

title: Things We Love  Shoes Glorious Shoes
description: Bob Dylan once sang of Boots of Spanish Leather, though these days soccer boots, cleats, shoes (your choice of nomenclature) are more likely to be made of the finest synthetics concocted in the laboratories of Beaverton, Ore., (Nike) and Herzogenaurach, Germany (Adidas and Puma).

title: Letter From Gen. Martin E. Dempsey
description: A letter from Gen. Martin E. Dempsey to Secretary of Defense Leon Panetta proposing removing the restrictions on women from many positions in the infantry and artillery.

title: Australian Open Chronicles: Melbourne Memories
description: Irina Falconi, an American who played at the Australian Open, wrote posts throughout the tournament for Straight Sets as she did during the United States Open last year. She has her own tumblr page, and can be followed on Twitter.

title: Iran Is Accused of Delaying Resumption of Nuclear Talks
description: A spokesman for the representative of the six big powers in nuclear talks with Iran expressed irritation on Wednesday with what he described as repeated changes and delays by the Iranian side in finalizing the date and place for the next round of negotiations.

title: The Slipper Room
description: When the Slipper Room, a beacon in the New York burlesque scene, shut its doors in 2010, supposedly for a renovation, downtown denizens wrung their hands, lamenting, There goes the Lower East Side. It would be, they assumed, replaced by condos or some anodyne macaron store. But the Slipper Room did finally reopen last fall, offering burlesque and comedy shows in a larger, three-story building. The acts are just as blue as before. On a recent night, a performer named Gal Friday, who wore little more than a string of red sequins around her waist, gyrated to a rock classic, Shortnin Bread, and picked up a dollar bill without the aid of her hands.

title: Attention, Narcissists
description: GO ON, ADMIT IT. What fashion-conscious person hasnt fantasized at some point in the last 70-some years of finding themselves on the International Best-Dressed List?

title: When Australia Soared on Film
description: The Last New Wave, the title of the Film Society of Lincoln Centers retrospective of the late-1970s resurgence of the Australian movie industry, might not sit well with everyone. What about Romania, you might ask, or Iran or South Korea?

title: Israels Election
description: The political opponents of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel were ecstatic at his apparent losses in Tuesdays elections. Haaretz, the left-leaning newspaper, called it a vote of no confidence that showed Mr. Netanyahu has failed in the political sphere, the foreign policy sphere and the socioeconomic sphere.

title: Unsettling News Intrudes Upon a Productions Smirk
description: At some point during rehearsals Collision, Lyle Kesslers new play about a college roommate from hell, underwent a metamorphosis, or at least a branding change. A press representative for the show announced last week that its creators, the Off Broadway troupe the Amoralists, are now billing the play as a drama, not a black comedy as originally announced.

title: A Choreographer Is a Centerpiece in a Show of Juxtapositions
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Philadelphia Museum of Arts exhibition celebrating Marcel Duchamp, John Cage, Merce Cunningham, Robert Rauschenberg and Jasper Johns  which closed on Monday  was in several ways a triumph. The show, called Dancing Around the Bride, successfully illustrated many (by no means all) of the connections among these five very different men  still provocative, still rightly controversial  and proved stimulating, informative, enlightening.

title: Sony Makes Deal for Electronic Dance Music
description: In the latest sign of the music industrys gold rush over electronic dance music, Sony Music has struck a deal with a leading independent dance label, Ultra Music. The arrangement calls for the labels to share acts, and gives one of Sonys divisions distribution rights to Ultras catalog in North America, which includes top D.J.s like Deadmau5, Steve Aoki, Calvin Harris and Benny Benassi.

title: Kashkari, Onetime $700 Billion Man at Treasury, Weighs Political Bid
description: More than four years after the financial crisis, one of the top figures behind the Bush administrations sweeping rescue plan is considering a return to government service.

title: Making a Film a Philanthropic Event
description: PARK CITY, Utah  Girl Rising is rapidly becoming one of the hottest cause documentaries in years, and its not even finished yet.

title: Ex-Outsiders, Now Basking in the Moment
description: PARK CITY, Utah  It was almost exactly one year ago that Quvenzhan Wallis, the star of Beasts of the Southern Wild, made her bad little self known to the world. After the premiere of the movie here at the Sundance Film Festival, Ms. Wallis, then 8, took to the stage with her cast mates and film crew. She received a standing ovation. Handed a mike, she introduced herself and announced, I like to have a party! Cue the hearts melting of 1,300 audience members.

title: Exploring the Many Options That Make  Recording Easy
description: Remember pocket voice recorders, and their fiddly (but cute) miniature cassette tapes that stored your business memos and interviews? These gadgets have largely gone the way of the dodo, because digital voice recorders replaced them. Digital recorders dont need the tiny tapes, they can record with less audio distortion and they offer extras like easy downloading of your recordings to a computer.

title: New Yorks Naked Trees
description: Trees in winter, at the New York Botanical Garden and Central Park.

title: Dormant but Not Forgotten
description: Winter is a lie.

title: App Smart: Digital Audio Recorders
description: Kit Eaton reviews apps that transform your phone or tablet into digital audio recorders.

title: A Legacy Threatened by Scorn
description: Teachers Julie Cavanagh and Adam Stevens listen to New Yorks mayor pour boiling oil on their union, to his talk of imposing more tests and using the scores to draw a stringent measure of each teacher, and they wonder what world he inhabits.

title: District 3 Winter Regional
description: Arch McKellar of Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., and Chuck Lamprey of White Plains, N.Y., won the Senior Pairs on Saturday at the District 3 Winter Regional in Rye Brook, N.Y. They finished more than two boards ahead of Howard Cohen of Oceanside, N.Y., and Charles Sharf of North Baldwin, N.Y., with Susan Schwartz of Scotch Plains, N.J., and Ed Hill of Bedminster, N.J., third.

title: A Constantly Changing Landscape
description: In Buffalo, an architecture of castoffs.

title: A Master of Accumulation
description: BUFFALO  In 2009, Dennis Maher, a professor of architecture at the University at Buffalo, bought an abandoned property from DYouville College for $10,000. It was a Buffalo double house, built just before the turn of the 20th century, as common a sight here as a maple tree.

title: A Tall House of Water
description: Leigh Osborne and his partner, Graham Voce, spotted the derelict water tower in 2010, from their apartment on the 36th floor of the Strata Tower in the citys Elephant and Castle neighborhood. From what they could tell, the lonely brick water tower in the nearby Kennington area, surrounded by a ring of new condominiums, was vacant and disintegrating. But Mr. Osborne, a property developer who is now 40, had to have it.

title: The High Life
description: A couple turned a landmarked water tower into a home.

title: Video: When Park City Becomes Music Central
description: This aint Hollywood, this is Park City! Nas shouted from the stage on Saturday night. He was performing in a pop-up club at the base of a ski lift on Main Street here (Im usually at Tao in Vegas or New York City. This is Tao in Utah. How real is that?), one of many musical acts to appear in the Sundance orbit. Here, a sampling of the nonfilm shows around town during the festival.

title: Shopping for Scandinavian Designs
description: Richard Wright, the Chicago auction house owner, goes shopping for modern designs produced from a region that he says deserves extra attention: Scandinavia.

title: Scandinavian Designs
description: AS THE OWNER of Wright auction house in Chicago, Richard Wright spends his days surrounded by covetable midcentury modern furnishings from around the world. For Mr. Wright, however, there is one region that deserves extra attention: Scandinavia.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. Our house has wood trim with an orangy varnish in most of the rooms. Should we paint or refinish it before putting the house on the market, or leave it as is?

title: Mix Master
description: The French designer Matali Crasset has built a highly successful career in a profession dominated by men. There are other prominent women designers, but their numbers are small, and Ms. Crasset, 47, whose signature mushroom-cap hair style has led some to call her the Joan of Arc of design, has created a special niche marked by a rigorous aesthetic. She began her career in 1991 in the office of the Italian designer Denis Santachiara. Two years later, she went to work for Philippe Starck on high-tech projects for Thomson, the consumer electronics company. She set up her business in 1998.

title: Warming Trend
description: A colorful spot in snow-covered Paris was a display of blankets from Zuzunaga, a company based in Barcelona and London, which took the top prize for textiles at the International Contemporary Furniture Fair last year. Founded in 2010 by Cristian Zuzunaga, a 34-year-old designer, the company specializes in bright, woven grids and organic abstractions. Mr. Zuzunaga has noted that his first love was biology, and that his early experience with microscopes led to an interest in close-ups. He named this collection Bitmap because of its pixilated motif, but he was also thinking about 21st-century modern architecture found in Tokyo, New York, Shanghai and London, he said.

title: Lamps That Leave an Afterglow
description: At Maison et Objet, a trade fair in Paris that ended Tuesday, Forestier, a French lighting manufacturer, showed its new collaborations with Arik Levy, the Paris-based designer, who was born in Israel. The results were predictably polished. Mr. Levy, who divides his time between high art (hes had several gallery shows of his sculptures) and industrial production for clients including Lanvin, Boucheron, Renault and Vitra, has enjoyed a long relationship with Forestier. This year he designed a hanging lantern of Tyvek and steel for outdoors that will be available at the MoMA store this spring. His Antenna series for Forestier (pendant version, shown) employs delicate metal wire, which was hand-woven to create subtle lighting screens. Mr. Levy also designed a table version of Antenna, in three sizes. All the lights take compact fluorescent light bulbs. Antenna is not yet available in the United States. Information: 011-33-1-40-36-13-10 or forestier.fr.

title: Sharing a Wealth of Ideas
description: Japan Creative, a nonprofit organization, supports traditional Japanese crafts, and the businesses that produce them, by matching leading Japanese artisans with Western design lions. Last year, Jasper Morrison created cast-iron cookware with the Oigen foundry, and Inga Semp collaborated with Koubei-gama (founded 1804) on ceramics with the traditional green glaze of Oribe ware. At Maison et Objet, Japan Creative introduced an alliance betweenFujisato Woodcraft and the Israeli designer Ron Gilad. The result was monastically simple walnut chests with interiors of paulownia, a wood typically used for storing kimonos. Mr. Gilad devised the elegant wrought-iron hardware. The pieces are still prototypes and the company has not as yet set prices.

title: Flatware With an Eastern Flavor
description: Toyo Ito is as sure-handed with tableware as he is with buildings. Mr. Ito, the Japanese architect whose team won a Golden Lion Award at the 2012 Venice Architecture Biennale for its concepts for new housing after the Tohoku earthquake and tsunami, recently designed flatware called Mu. Introduced in Paris by the Italian company Alessi, the pattern complements Ku, the delicate porcelain service Mr. Ito created for Alessi in 2006. Mu (hexagon in Japanese) refers to the six-sided shape of the handle, which resembles chopsticks and creates a sharp contrast with the oval spoon bowls and knife blades. The pattern is embodied in a wide range of utensils, including serving pieces. A five-piece place setting is $87.50 and will be available next month. Information: (212) 941-7300 or alessi.com.

title: Sales at Canvas, South Street Linen and Others
description: Canvas is discounting all colored glass as much as 50 percent, through Sunday (the Ash ball-stemmed goblet, shown, originally about $12, is about $8; the Bario bubble goblet, originally $10, is about $6); 199 Lafayette Street (Kenmare Street), (646) 873-6698 and 123 West 17th Street (Avenue of the Americas), (212) 372-7706, canvashomestore.com.

title: Behind Parks Name, a Civil War Soldier Who Helped Give the N.R.A. Birth
description: A few months ago, Andrew Soar wondered why somebody named Wingate was so important that a park had been named for him  the 5.89 acres in the shadow of Kings County Hospital Center in Brooklyn where Mr. Soar sometimes works out.

title: Robots for Tasks Large and Small, Light and Heavy
description: At the Automate 2013 trade show in Chicago, makers of industrial robots and machine-vision equipment demonstrated factory applications like medication sorting and burger making.

title: Robot Makers Spread Global Gospel of Automation
description: CHICAGO  The robot equipment industry has one word for the alarmist articles and television news programs that predict a robot is about to steal your job: Fiddlesticks!

title: Why A.I.G. Did Not Sue the Government
description: When American International Groups directors met this month to consider joining a lawsuit against the same federal agencies that rescued it with a $182 billion financial crisis bailout, they received a stark warning from their lawyers. One lawyer said that the lawsuit had only a 20 percent chance of succeeding, according to a document released on Wednesday.

title: Dodgers and Time Warner Cable Near Deal for TV Channel
description: Well before a group led by Guggenheim Partners acquired the Los Angeles Dodgers for $2.15 billion last year from Frank McCourt, the team expected a financial windfall from its cable television rights.

title: Does Apple Need a Cheaper iPhone?
description: In the past month, there have been reports that Apple is working on a smaller, cheaper iPhone. But the latest sales numbers do not make it appear that Apple needs to sell one.

title: Honoring Drug War Dead, and Spurring a Debate
description: MEXICO CITY  Reeling from a drug war that has killed tens of thousands and a boom in violent crime in general, Mexico has built a memorial to victims of violence. But like a crime scene still under investigation, it sits off limits behind white tarp, wrapped in questions and uncertainty.

title: Hurdles Remain for Jaguar Habitat
description: Last fall, remote cameras in a rugged expanse of desert grasslands in Southern Arizona captured arresting images of a jaguar slinking through the underbrush, its yellow eyes fixed on some distant sight. The photos add to the dozen or so documented sightings of the endangered cat on American soil in the last century.

title: How to Gain From the Pain of a Squandered Lead
description: SAN DIEGO  On the 18th fairway of the South Course at Torrey Pines, roughly 85 yards from the pin, Kyle Stanley stood with a club in his hand. It was Tuesday afternoon, 359 days after he stood in roughly the same spot holding a sand wedge and a three-stroke lead at the Farmers Insurance Open.

title: Algeria Gas Compound Lacked Armed Guards
description: HOUSTON  The companies operating the gas facility in the Sahara that was attacked last week had chosen not to deploy armed guards inside the sprawling compound, leading security analysts to question whether the assault by more than 30 Islamist militants might have been slowed if security had been tighter.

title: How to Get America Online
description: ON Monday, President Obama said that during his second term, Americans would act together to build the roads and networks and research labs that will bring new jobs and businesses to our shores and that we cannot cede to other nations the technology that will power new jobs and new industries  we must claim its promise.

title: The Taliban of Timbuktu
description: BEFORE the recent French intervention in Mali began, 412,000 people had already left their homes in the countrys north, fleeing torture, summary executions, recruitment of child soldiers and sexual violence against women at the hands of fundamentalist militants. Late last year, in Algeria and southern Mali, I interviewed dozens of Malians from the north, including many who had recently fled. Their testimonies confirmed the horrors that radical Islamists, self-proclaimed warriors of God, have inflicted on their communities.

title: The Last Holdout in New England, Rhode Island Weighs Gay Marriage
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.  Rhode Island, the only state in New England that has not legalized gay marriage, began taking up the matter this week. The State House is expected to pass a bill Thursday that would allow anyone to marry any eligible person regardless of gender.

title: For Obamas New Term, Start Here
description: Point to a group of toddlers in an upper-middle-class neighborhood in America, and its a good bet that they will go to college, buy nice houses and enjoy white-collar careers.

title: A Month After His Firing, a Coach Understands
description: LUTHERVILLE, Md.  The day he lost his job, Cam Cameron decided to go to his son Dannys high school basketball game. As soon as Cameron arrived at the gymnasium, he could sense that people were staring at him. It struck him as pity, or perhaps morbid curiosity.

title: True Believers in Justice
description: The filmmaker Dawn Porter follows Travis Williams, a young public defender in the Deep South, who struggles against long hours, low pay and staggering caseloads to bring justice to all.

title: Netanyahu-Obama Ties May Thaw After Israel Election
description: WASHINGTON  For President Obama, whose relationship with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel has often resembled that of a couple trapped in a loveless marriage, the last three months must have offered some grim satisfaction.

title: True Believers in Justice
description: Id always wanted to be a lawyer, but unlike Travis Williams  the subject of this Op-Doc video  I never wanted to be a public defender. I didnt understand how anyone could represent people who did terrible things. Criminals were not people I wanted to help.

title: The Making of Israels New Power Broker
description: TEL AVIV  They pitched tents along Rothschild Boulevard and took to the streets in unprecedented numbers, hundreds of thousands demonstrating against the rising costs of gas, apartments, even cottage cheese.

title: Democrats in Senate Confront Doubts at Home on Gun Laws
description: BECKLEY, W.Va.  Talk of stricter gun control has stirred up a lot of unease here, a place where hunters vie for top prize (a 26-inch LED television) in the Big Buck Photo Contest, and ads for a gun-simulator game ask, Feel like shooting something today?

title: Helping Degree Seekers Finish What They Start
description: There is a paradox in American higher education: of the millions of students who apply to and enter postsecondary degree programs, only about half end up graduating within six years.

title: Misconceptions
description: Francis Lorson, the longtime chief deputy clerk of the Supreme Court, once told me the following story. On a January day in the mid-1970s, he and Justice Potter Stewart were in an official car traveling from the court to the White House, where the justice was to preside at a swearing-in ceremony. As they rode along Pennsylvania Avenue, they saw a crowd heading in the opposite direction, up Capitol Hill toward the court.

title: Redistricting in Virginia Hurts Blacks, Democrats Say
description: On Monday, one of Virginias state senators attended the inauguration: Henry L. Marsh III, a longtime civil rights lawyer, who played hooky to witness a milestone for an African-American president.

title: Mexican Court Frees Woman Imprisoned in Kidnapping
description: MEXICO CITY  A Supreme Court panel in Mexico voted Wednesday to free a French woman serving a 60-year sentence for kidnapping, ending a case that has become emblematic of problems in the countrys opaque justice system and that has strained relations with France.

title: Republican Myopia
description: Congressional Republicans like nothing more than beating a dead horse if it might embarrass the Obama administration  like their unceasing attempt to accuse the administration of lying to the American people about the attack in Benghazi, Libya, that killed four Americans, including Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens.

title: Hollywood Stardom by Way of Doughnuts
description: Melena Ryzik visits the New Orleans bakery of Dwight Henry, a non-actor who was cast as a lead in the Oscar-nominated movie Beasts of the Southern Wild.

title: First Overwhelmed by the Hurricane, Now Struggling to Fight Off the Cold
description: It was too cold for Daniel Choi to stay in his storm-gutted home in Gerritsen Beach, Brooklyn, so he left his two pet turtles, Michelangelo and Leonardo, behind to move in temporarily with friends. But on Wednesday, when he stopped by his home to feed them, he made an upsetting discovery. Plummeting temperatures in the still-heatless house had left the two turtles frozen under a sheet of ice.

title: What Should Tax Reform Do?
Digital Medical Records
description: To the Editor:

title: Clinics in New York City Schools
description: To the Editor:

title: Future of Catholic Schools
description: To the Editor:

title: At the Library, a Lending Doll to Spread the Joy
Individualism vs. the Common Good
description: To the Editor:

title: Keds Enlists Taylor Swift to Transmit Girl Power
description: IN the 1960s, among fads like Mad Libs and the Twist, there was a popular type of joke known as a Tom Swifty, named for the childrens-book hero Tom Swift, in which a punning verb or adverb set off a sentence: Ill have a martini, Tom said dryly. We just struck oil, Tom gushed. Hurry up and get in the back of the ship, Tom said sternly.

title: Obama Reboot
description: President Obamas Inaugural Address was an unapologetic, unequivocal progressive manifesto of domestic policies.

title: Either With Him or Against Him
description: Nobody knows what Kevin Garnett will say or do when Carmelo Anthony steps onto the floor in Boston on Thursday night, when the Knicks and the Celtics meet for the first time since Garnetts on-court posturing turned Anthony into a backstage vigilante early this month in New York.

title: Indianas Gambling Lock Loosened by Competition
description: HAMMOND, Ind.  There is Las Vegas. There is Atlantic City. But when it comes to listing popular American gambling locations, another powerhouse often gets overlooked: Indiana.

title: Heart Big Enough to Care for 7 Children
description: One day almost four years ago, Genesis McBride was watching television in her Brooklyn apartment when the phone rang. It was a caseworker from New York Citys Administration for Childrens Services. There was an emergency.

title: Arms and the Women
description: Women in the military are going to get to serve in combat. They killed the Equal Rights Amendment to keep this from happening, but, yet, here we are. And about time.

title: N.C.A.A. Admits Mishandling Miami Inquiry
description: The N.C.A.A., facing increasingly fierce scrutiny regarding its role as the administrator of college athletics, said Wednesday that its enforcement staff improperly obtained information in its high-profile investigation involving the University of Miami.

title: Intent on Being First, Cuomo Used All Means to Enact Gun Limits
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo was in his 39th floor office above Third Avenue in Manhattan, after meeting with corporate executives to ask for help lobbying Congress for federal Hurricane Sandy aid, when he heard the news: A gunman had opened fire in an elementary school in Newtown, Conn., killing 20 children.

title: Kansas Governor and G.O.P. Seek to End Income Tax
description: TOPEKA, Kan.  President Obama stood on the steps of the Capitol in Washington on Monday afternoon and laid out an expansive liberal agenda for the nation. Inside the Kansas State Capitol here this week, Gov. Sam Brownback and Republican legislators have been drafting what could be a blueprint for the other side.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, Jan. 24, 2013
description: We give up our rights one piece at a time.

title: Long Island College Hospital in Brooklyn May Be Forced to Close
description: Long Island College Hospital, a community hospital that has for years been losing patients and revenue in a gentrifying neighborhood of Brooklyn, could soon close, officials said Wednesday.

title: Women Have Long Served in Combat Roles
description: 12:15 p.m. | Updated

title: Linda Riss Pugach, Whose Life Was Ripped From Headlines, Dies at 75
description: She was 22, a sheltered, dark-haired Bronx beauty said to look like Elizabeth Taylor.

title: Can Republicans Change Their Spots?
description: If the Republican Party were a profit-seeking corporation, the current management would be tossed.

title: Bipartisan Filibuster Deal Is Taking Shape in the Senate
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democratic and Republican leaders are nearing an agreement on new limits to the filibuster, an effort to speed action in the often-clogged chamber by prohibiting senators from using a common tactic to slow the legislative process.

title: Hispanics in East Haven Are Wary of Kinder Tone
description: EAST HAVEN, Conn.  This winter, the Hispanic businesses that line snowy Main Street in this blue-collar suburb look so peaceful and prosperous that it is hard to believe some customers were shying away as recently as a year ago, afraid they would be pulled over or questioned as they did their grocery shopping.

title: A Howard Trade Rumor? The Nets Lopez Has Heard It All Before
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Nets center Brook Lopez started laughing before the question was even finished being asked. The latest rumor linking Lopez with Dwight Howard of the Lakers in a trade left him more amused than annoyed. And not for the first time.

title: Broccoli Again?
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  I honestly didnt know that Michael Shteyman could sing.

title: Corrections: January 24, 2013
description: NATIONAL

title: Cleared of One 95 Murder, 3 Men Have Conviction Vacated in a 2nd
description: Three men who had been imprisoned for 17 years for two murders they had long denied committing were released on Wednesday night after a judge granted the prosecutions request to vacate the last remaining convictions.

title: A Debt Crisis Averted, for Now
description: In an unusual recognition of reality, House Republicans backed away on Wednesday from a chaotic default crisis and dropped their ruinous demand that spending be cut on an equal basis with a rise in the debt ceiling. On a vote of 285 to 144, the House agreed to suspend the debt ceiling for three months, adding the puerile condition that the Senates pay should be delayed until it passes a budget. The Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, said the extension would pass his chamber and promised to come up with a budget, four years late.

title: Lottery Numbers
Syracuses Democratic Mayor Gets Under Governors Skin
description: ALBANY  Mayor Stephanie A. Miner of Syracuse earned her political chops from the first Governor Cuomo, whom she served as a regional representative and speaks of with reverence.

title: Air Force Leaders Testify on Culture That Led to Sexual Assaults of Recruits
description: WASHINGTON  A weak command structure and a climate of fear among female personnel created the conditions that led to widespread instances of sexual assault of Air Force recruits by their instructors at Lackland Air Force Base in Texas, senior Air Force commanders said Wednesday.

title: An M.T.A. Hearing Asks: Is Everyone O.K. With This Service Increase?
description: The public hearings of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority have long been an exercise in commuter catharsis.

title: Anthony Shoots More as Knicks Win Less
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  Carmelo Anthonys biggest responsibility is to ignite the Knicks offense and be the teams most reliable point producer. He has fulfilled that assignment as the season approaches its midway point, leading the Knicks in scoring in 30 of the 32 games he has played.

title: His Conviction Overturned, Man Is Let Out of Prison After 23 Years
description: The Brooklyn district attorneys office agreed on Wednesday to release a man who served 23 years in prison for murder, a week after a federal judge tossed out the mans conviction, calling it rotten from Day 1.

title: Camerons Speech a Gamble for Tories as Much as for Europe
description: LONDON  It was a speech months, even years, in the making. When it was finally delivered, Prime Minister David Cameron had essentially reset the tables for what has the makings of a giant political poker game  for himself, Britain, Europe and his Conservative Party.

title: Egypt: Polio Virus Is Found in Cairos Sewers
description: The polio virus has been found in the sewers of Cairo, and it appears to have come from Pakistan, the World Health Organization said Wednesday. Egypt has not had a case of polio since 2004. A vaccination drive is being planned for Feb. 25, and health workers are canvassing the neighborhoods where the sewage samples were taken, looking for children or adults who may have recently been paralyzed, said Sona Bari, a spokeswoman for the W.H.O. Pakistan has said it will post teams at its international airports vaccinating all outward-bound passengers under age 5. Last month, at least nine Pakistani volunteers in an internationally supported polio vaccination drive were killed by militants across Pakistan in a campaign of intimidation that has hurt efforts to eradicate the disease there. Pakistan is one of the last three countries, with Afghanistan and Nigeria, with indigenous polio.

title: Venezuela: Officials Say Plot Targeted Vice President
description: Officials said Wednesday that they had uncovered a plot to assassinate the top two government figures who have been running the country during the absence of the cancer-stricken President Hugo Chvez. Justice Minister Nstor Reverol said the Venezuelan ultraright in complicity with the ultraright outside the country were behind a plot to kill the two officials, Vice President Nicols Maduro and the National Assembly president, Diosdado Cabello. Speaking later at a pro-government rally, Mr. Maduro mentioned the plot allegations and promised to use a hard hand against the right-wing conspiracy. Mr. Reverol said that security had been increased.

title: A Mulligan by Mickelson on Tax Talk
description: SAN DIEGO  Three days after creating a firestorm with his public airing of his tax grievances, Phil Mickelson apologized for being, well, himself.

title: Rockets White Says Hes Close to Returning
description: Royce White and the Houston Rockets have apparently reached an agreement over Whites mental health care, ending a tense standoff and paving the way for White, a talented rookie forward, to play for the Rockets Development League affiliate.

title: Tracking Battery Problems
description: From March 20, 1991, through Oct. 9, 2012, the Federal Aviation Administration logged 132 incidents involving batteries on airplanes.

title: China: Former Powerful Official Hires Lawyers
description: Employees at the office of two lawyers in Beijing, Li Guifang and Wang Zhaofeng, have said in telephone interviews that the two have been hired to represent Bo Xilai, the former Communist Party chief of Chongqing who was felled by a scandal last year. Mr. Bos wife, Gu Kailai, was given a commuted life sentence last summer after she was found guilty of murdering Neil Heywood, a British businessman. The party announced last September that Mr. Bo, whose father was a Communist elder, would be tried on criminal charges including corruption and trying to cover up Mr. Heywoods murder. Mr. Li and Mr. Wang were unavailable for comment on Tuesday, but their assistants at the law office, Deheng, said Mr. Bo, who has been detained since last spring, and his family had appointed them to represent him. The assistants said they had no information on any date or location for a trial. In early January, an official news media report said Mr. Bos case had been handed to judicial organs, which ignited speculation that Mr. Bos trial might take place soon.

title: Cardinal Jozef Glemp of Poland Is Dead at 83
description: Cardinal Jozef Glemp, the spiritual leader of Polands Roman Catholics for 25 years, who helped steer his nation through a historic and relatively peaceful transition from Communism to democracy in 1989, but who was dogged by allegations of anti-Semitism, died on Wednesday in Warsaw. He was 83.

title: Lopez Continues All-Star-Caliber Season as the Nets Keep Winning
description: MINNEAPOLIS  Coaches had to file their ballots for N.B.A. All-Star reserves Wednesday morning, so nothing Brook Lopez did against the Minnesota Timberwolves on Wednesday night could sway opinions. Not that Lopez will be sweating Thursdays televised announcement, which comes on an off day in Memphis.

title: Japanese Trade Deficit Was $78 Billion in 2012
description: TOKYO  Japan on Thursday reported a record annual trade deficit in 2012, the second straight year in the red for an exporting nation that has long built its wealth on its vast trading surpluses.

title: Gaboriks Big Night Finally Does Trick
description: The Rangers had not won a game this season, and something radical had to be done. Marian Gaborik and his new linemates provided it.

title: Word of the Day | anonymity
description: anonymity \a-n-ni-m-te\ noun

title: To Raise Graduation Rate, Colleges Are Urged to Help a Changing Student Body
description: In an effort to improve the college completion rate and fend off new regulations, a commission of the nations six leading higher-education associations is calling for extensive reforms to serve a changing college population  one increasingly composed of older and part-time students.

title: N.A.A.C.P. in Support of Soda Industry
description: The civil rights group argues that the soda ban should be set aside because its enactment violated fundamental separation-of-powers principles.

title: Azarenka to Meet Li in Womens Final
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  It will be Li Na versus Victoria Azarenka in the womens final at the Australian Open, and though Lis straight-set victory over Maria Sharapova in their semifinal Thursday brooked no argument, the same could not be said for Azarenkas straight-set victory over the 19-year-old American Sloane Stephens.

title: Klinsmann Explains, and Keeps Explaining, His Use of 24/7
description: TORRANCE, Calif.  Earlier this week I sat down with Jurgen Klinsmann, coach of the United States mens soccer team, for a lengthy chat about the coming World Cup qualifiers.

title: Whats On Thursday
description: 8 P.M. (NBC) 30 ROCK Liz (Tina Fey) tries to save TGS from cancellation; Tracy (Tracy Morgan) and Jenna (Jane Krakowski, above, with Mr. Morgan) start to work on their Plan Bs; and Kenneth (Jack McBrayer) helps Jack (Alec Baldwin) appoint a new president of NBC. On Parks and Recreation, at 8:30, Leslie (Amy Poehler) and April (Aubrey Plaza) handle a garbage route to get more women hired in government; Tom (Aziz Ansari) tries to build his business by persuading Andy (Chris Pratt) and Ben (Adam Scott) to teach him more about basketball; and Ron (Nick Offerman) baby-sits for the children of Diane (Lucy Lawless). On The Office, at 9, Dwight (Rainn Wilson) struggles to keep Darryl (Craig Robinson) from moving to Philadelphia, and Jim (John Krasinski) is forced to miss Ceces first recital. On 1600 Penn, at 9:30, President Gilchrist (Bill Pullman) uses his position to track down someone of importance to the family, while Emily (Jenna Elfman) is determined to defy protocol when the Austrian chancellor (David St. James) and his wife (Rebecca Wisocky) visit.

title: Cat Rescues in China Raise Host of New Questions
description: BEIJING  The crazy meowing from a truck crashed on a highway outside Changsha, in central China, told rescuers this was no ordinary cargo; inside, over 1,000 cats and kittens were crammed into bamboo cages, headed for restaurant tables in the southern city of Guangzhou, Chinese media reported.

title: North Korea Issues Blunt New Threat to United States
description: WASHINGTON  A blunt and explicit threat on Thursday from North Korea that its weapons programs would target the United States, and that it would proceed with a third and higher-level nuclear test, poses a stark challenge to the Obama administration at a time when it hoped to focus its major diplomatic effort on restraining Irans less-advanced nuclear program.

title: News Quiz | January 24, 2013
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Paris Opera Ballet Picks Outsider for New Director
description: PARIS  Benjamin Millepied, the choreographer and a former principal at New York City Ballet, will be the new director of dance at the Paris Opera Ballet, starting in September 2014.

title: What Made Dabangg 2 a Hit?
description: The action-comedy Dabangg 2, starring Salman Khan, has surpassed the 2 billion-rupee ($40.9 million) mark to becomethe third highest-grossing Bollywood production ever.

title: IHT Quick Read: Jan. 24
description: NEWS  In one of her final appearances as secretary of state, Hillary Rodham Clinton on Wednesday vigorously defended her handling of last Septembers attack on the United States diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, which killed four Americans and prompted a scathing review of State Department procedures. Michael R. Gordon reports from Washington.

title: Test Yourself | English, Jan. 24, 2013
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article From Dawns Early Light, a Day Filled With Pomp and Exuberance.

title: Floridas Python Hunting Contest
description: In Florida Mounts a Hunt for Creatures That Maintain a Very Low Profile, Lizette Alvarez writes about Florida wildlife officials innovative contest to reduce the number of invasive Burmese pythons living there.

title: A Conversation With: Bar Council of India Chairman Manan Kumar Mishra
description: The criminal justice system in India has come under scrutiny in the run-up to the Delhi gang rape trial, which opened this week in a specially designated fast-track court in the capital.

title: The Debt Ceiling and Playing With Fire
description: Simon Johnson, former chief economist of the International Monetary Fund, is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: Should Women Be Allowed to Fight on the Front Lines Alongside Men?
description: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta is ending the militarys ban on women in combat.

title: Getting to Know You
description: Lets get to know each other better. In a real, analog kind of way.

title: SFJazz Center Opens in California
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Congratulations, Bill Cosby told a roomful of jazz patrons on Wednesday, near the outset of the opening-night concert at the SFJazz Center here. This is your place, you know.

title: Lessons From a College Student: Finding Your Fit on Campus
The Early Word: On the Front
description: In Todays Times:

title: Senior Bowls Surprises, Polarizing Prospects and Small-School Standouts
description: MOBILE, Ala  Much will be written about the players who have helped or hurt themselves the most with their Senior Bowl week performances. In truth, its far too early in the process to form an accurate opinion on where players are likely to be drafted. Further film study, medical evaluations, pro day workouts and the combine will all have a major say when it comes to the ultimate destinations of these prospects.

title: Britain May Quit E.U.
description: But certain other members are quite happy where they are.

title: Britains Prime Minister Defends Decision to Seek Vote on European Union
description: PARIS  Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain on Thursday defended his decision to seek a referendum on his countrys membership in the European Union, saying his goal was to overhaul the 27-nation bloc, not to retreat into isolation.

title: Grief Over New Depression Diagnosis
description: When the American Psychiatric Association unveils a proposed new version of its Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, the bible of psychiatric diagnoses, it expects controversy. Illnesses get added or deleted, acquire new definitions or lists of symptoms. Everyone from advocacy groups to insurance companies to litigators  all have an interest in whats defined as mental illness  pays close attention. Invariably, complaints ensue.

title: Commerzbank to Cut Up to 6,000 Jobs
description: LONDON  Commerzbank, the second-largest lender in Germany, is planning to cut up to 6,000 jobs in a bid to increase earnings, joining other European banks that have announced restructuring plans in recent months.

title: When Employees Wonder Whats Going On
description: Bryan, we dont know whats going on anymore.

title: The Price of a Stolen Childhood
description: The detective spread out the photographs on the kitchen table, in front of Nicole, on a December morning in 2006. She was 17, but in the pictures, she saw the face of her 10-year-old self, a half-grown girl wearing make-up. The bodies in the images were broken up by pixelation, but Nicole could see the outline of her father, forcing himself on her. Her mother, sitting next to her, burst into sobs.

title: Save a Tree, Use Real Cork
description: ESTREMOZ, Portugal I had always thought plastic wine corks and screw caps were tacky, but now I have a good reason for avoiding them.

title: Does the Concept of Forgiveness Have a Place in the Courtroom?
description: Paul Tulliss article aboutrestorative justice, an alternative criminal law process, gave rise to a powerful debate in our comments section.

title: Bad Education
description: TOKYO  Japans educational system consistently makes the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Developments top-20 list, and the Economist Intelligence Unit recently ranked Japans schools fourth after Finland, South Korea and Hong Kong.

title: Rocky Balboa and Ranking Joe Flacco
description: I assume everybody thinks theyre a top-five quarterback. I mean, I think Im the best. I dont think Im top five, I think Im the best. I dont think Id be very successful at my job if I didnt feel that way. I mean, cmon? Thats not really too tough of a question. Joe Flacco, in April

title: Wanelo: Social Commerce Site Is Big With Young Shoppers
description: The upsides to shopping online are plentiful  skipping long checkout lines and avoiding stuffy dressing rooms, to name two. But the downside is that unless you know exactly what youre shopping for, it can be challenging to find great new things to put in your cart.

title: Opinion Report: Yair Lapid
description: From the editorial page

title: Sternlichts Starwood to Buy Distressed Debt Manager for $1.05 Billion
description: The real estate mogul Barry S. Sternlicht is making his latest deal.

title: Republican Governors Open New Front in Tax Debate
description: 10:49 a.m. | Updated  Overhauling the tax system is the subject of endless talk and little action in Washington. But as Republican governors in a range of states start to act aggressively on the issue, they are setting up limited but politically ambitious and potentially telling experiments in what might be possible nationwide.

title: Daily Report: Apples Stock Drops Despite Huge Profit
description: Apple on Wednesday reported the kind of quarter most big companies would envy, posting a profit of $13.1 billion and selling 28 percent more iPhones and 48 percent more iPads, its two biggest products, Nick Wingfield reports in Thursdays New York Times.

title: Old Technology Modernizes a Camera Sensor
description: Fuji has reached back into film history to tweak a digital light sensor technology that appears in the new $600 Fuji X20 consumer camera.

title: Inside A.I.G.s Decision Not to Sue
description: It was not just lawmakers and taxpayers who expressed concern when the board of the American International Group met this month to consider joining a lawsuit against the government agencies that rescued the insurer during the financial crisis. The companys lawyers, too, delivered a stark warning to the board, with one saying the lawsuit had only a 20 percent chance of success, according to a letter filed on Wednesday.

title: India Rape Trial Starts With Renewed Ban on Media Coverage
description: The trial of five men accused in the gang rape of a 23-year-old woman in a moving bus in New Delhi is being watched closely as a symbol of Indias commitment to justice for women, but information about the ongoing court proceedings may be scarce.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Assange Assails Propaganda Film, and Netflix Surges
description: Netflix surprised Wall Street with a fourth-quarter profit of $8 million and a customer base of more than 27 million American households, causing one analyst to say the company has risen from the ashes of its disastrous 2011. Shares jumped 30 percent in after-hours trading. Apple reported a profit of $13.1 billion and a 28 percent increase in the sale of iPhones but that still wasnt enough for investors, who pounded the stock down 11 percent in after-hours trading.

title: A Memorable Concert
description: Dear Diary:

title: Directors Favored, Directors Snubbed: Whats Going On?
description: LOS ANGELES  On Groundhog Day, Hollywoods black-tie set will watch the Directors Guild of America hand its feature award to a filmmaker whose movie will go on to win the best picture Oscar three weeks later.

Denying American Scots Their Holiday Haggis
description: LONDON  Scots at home and abroad will be sitting down on Friday night for Burns Night suppers to commemorate their national poet with a feast of haggis.

title: An Insurance Company With an Army
description: Jonathan Chait and Greg Sargent both weigh in on the absurd Republican claim that theyll produce a plan to balance the budget in 10 years, without a penny in additional revenue. Chait points out that the Ryan plan, even if you accepted all its magic asterisks, still didnt produce a balanced budget until 2040. Sargent, armed with numbers from the Center on Budget and Policy Priorities, points out that if the GOP were to honor its promises not to cut military spending or benefits for those over 55, youd have to impose savage cuts on everything else.

title: Supernatural Tales: Manuel Gonzales Talks About The Miniature Wife
description: The stories in Manuel Gonzaless first collection, The Miniature Wife (Riverhead), are shot through with outlandish events relayed in an understated tone. In the first story, passengers in an airplane circle above the same city for more than 20 years. In the title story, a husband accidentally shrinks his wife to the size of a coffee mug. In a recent e-mail interview, Mr. Gonzales discussed his use of the supernatural, the writing center he runs in Austin, Tex., and more. Below are edited excerpts from the conversation:

title: Kaepernick Fans Can Now Look the Part
description: Before Cam Newton was selected with the first pick in the 2011 draft, Jerry Richardson, the owner of the Carolina Panthers, sought assurance that the quarterback was tattoo-free and would remain that way.

title: Alan Blinder on the Lessons of the Financial Crisis
description: Alan S. Blinder describes his new book, After the Music Stopped, as a second draft of the history of the financial crisis and the governments response. He argues that many Americans still do not understand what went wrong, and he contends that the government still does not get enough credit for the successes of its policies.

title: Adele Joins the Ranks of Tom Jones and a-ha
description: Well, we called it (as did anyone with a smidgen of pop culture savvy): Adele will be performing at the Oscars. Shell sing her nominated song, Skyfall, the first Bond theme to be an Oscar nominee since For Your Eyes Only in 1981.

title: Suspect in Killing Escapes Police Station in Brooklyn
description: A suspect in a fatal 2010 brawl in Park Slope, Brooklyn, escaped from a police station house early Thursday morning, fleeing on foot and setting off an extensive manhunt, the police said.

title: What Were Reading
description: Bon Apptit: All hail the Tater Tot.  Jeff Gordinier

title: Alain de Botton: By the Book
description: The author of How to Think More About Sex was impressed as a young man by Kierkegaards claim to read only writings by men who have been executed.

title: Octogenarian Opens Jaipur Lit Fest With Rousing Speech
description: From a tiny octogenarian writer came a rousing, defiant speech that set the tone for the sixth Jaipur Literature Festival, which opened Thursday to the sounds of chanting Buddhist monks, beating drums called nagadas and Indias national anthem.

title: Video of Kerrys Confirmation Hearing
description: Senator John Kerry, a Democrat from Massachusetts, returns Thursday morning to the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, of which he was once the chairman, to answer questions at his confirmation hearing as secretary of state.

title: On Our Radar: Salt Lake Smog
description: The Environmental Protection Agency has singled out the Salt Lake region as having the nations worst air for much of January, when an icy fog smothers valleys and traps soot for days or weeks at a time. The air is so tainted that more than 100 Utah doctors are pressing the authorities to lower highway speed limits, curb industrial activity and make mass transit free for the rest of the winter. [Associated Press]

title: The Chvez Constitutional
description: Its been two weeks now since Venezuelas telecom regulator served a cease-and-desist order on Venezuelas last free-to-air opposition broadcaster, Globovision. Some recent content, the station was told, broke the law by inciting hate, panic or disturbing public order.

title: Dalai Lama Stresses Science and Secularism in Jaipur
description: As an eager audience settled into their seats on a chilly Thursday morning, the first day of the Jaipur Literature Festival, six monks from the Drepung Loseling monastery, clad in orange robes, sat on the stage with their legs crossed and hands pressed together as in prayer. A calm settled over the audience as the monks deep, throaty chants echoed across the front lawns.

title: Living With Cancer: The Good Patient Syndrome
description: I remember when being good seemed strategic.

title: Nokia Reports Profit but Fails to Soothe Investors
description: BERLIN  The Finnish phone maker Nokia on Thursday reported its first quarterly profit in the almost two years since entering its smartphone alliance with Microsoft, but the companys shares fell as doubts persisted about the companys ability to accomplish a turnaround.
